programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of £280,000. Karen is torn: her heart is pulling her towards a new life abroad, but her adult daughter Danielle wishes her to remain in Britain. While Jasmine Harman finds her some tempting offers in Chamonix in the French Alps, Jonnie Irwin shows her the trendy east side of London.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Something unprecedented happens in the First Dates restaurant tonight. When stunning 25-year-old Sasha is stood up, an unexpected knight in shining armour is waiting in the wings - waiter Sam. Meanwhile, 38-year-old sales manager Scott, who is looking for someone to mend his broken heart after the failure of an eight-year relationship, meets 28-year-old PA Victoria, and 55-year-old receptionist Debbie has her first date with a woman, in the shape of 59-year-old divorced security guard Ann.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: Staying Healthy: A Doctor's Guide
programme.desc: Dr Pixie McKenna crunches the NHS's health data to reveal what made people ill in 2016. She believes that if people understand when and how the nation falls ill, many will have a better chance of staying well in the year ahead. She reveals how changing the clocks could be a health hazard, and why it's not just cases of cold and flu that rocket when the kids go back to school.(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob and Sharon are in Ireland to say goodbye to her dad, while his irrepressible mum, Mia travels from America to pay her version of respects, and do some jumper shopping. With Fran reeling in shock and Rob still unable to find the right time to talk about his almost-secret collapse, all roads are leading to a dramatic series finale. Comedy starring Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan, Ashley Jensen and in one of her final roles, Carrie Fisher. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Rhod Gilbert spend 48 hours in Florida's largest city, for a densely packed mini-break including art, art deco slobbing, alligators, yoga, speedboats and dominoes. They also squeeze in an airboat tour of the Florida Everglades and a trip to Little Havana.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who have lived in the same home for 40 years decide between new properties either side of the Channel. Sheila is drawn to Bodmin, Cornwall, where she spent her childhood holidays, while Fred is keen to up sticks to Limousin in France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple on the verge of retirement decide between homes either side of the Channel. While Tony has his eye on Shropshire, an area he feels is familiar and beautiful, Kimm is drawn to the French way of life the Dordogne offers.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect looks back at some of the most creative builds he has encountered on his travels around the world, from a stunning glass house overlooking Italy's Lake Lugano to an ingenious studio apartment in Barcelona featuring high tech multi-functional furniture. Plus, a unique German water tower and a Texan house made of beer cans.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who struggled to find their first marital home, including Rupreet and Sundeep who had their hearts set on a specific area in Harrow. Phil also revisits Paul and Elly, who searched for a property in Bristol, to see if they found the perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs
programme.desc: Chefs are known for being fiery and temperamental. But what happens when they walk out, leaving restaurants in the lurch? These days, desperate owners call the relief agency for an emergency chef, who must master unfamiliar menus, handle inexperienced staff and satisfy demanding owners and customers. Here, cameras follows three such chefs as they descend on a luxury London hotel, a Devon manor house and a busy Midlands pub.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill

Leah speaks to Breck's mother, who is determined to improve other children's awareness of online dangers.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.sub-title: The Duchess, the Killer and Her Lover: Countdown to Murder.
programme.desc: Documentary using dramatic reconstructions to examine some of Britain's most notorious murders, charting the last few days leading up to the killings from the perspectives of both the perpetrators and the victims. The first edition focuses on Jane Andrews, a former dresser to the Duchess of York, who bludgeoned and stabbed to death her millionaire boyfriend Thomas Cressman in an act of revenge after he told her that he would never propose.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior submits a cartoon in a competition and wins first prize, so Michael takes him to meet TV executives to try to get his talent noticed. Meanwhile, Claire threatens to break up with Tony unless he can bring something fresh into their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul Bohill and Steve and Ben Pinner face their biggest eviction yet - taking on squatters in a large central London office block. With the help of the police, they try to remove a suspected group of 70 from the building, but with a barricade in place, the team faces a challenging operation ahead. Elsewhere, officers are confronted by an army of family and friends when they attempt to enforce a writ at the property of a debtor, and face a difficult eviction at the north London home of a heavily pregnant tenant and her family, after the council fails to pay the rent to the landlord.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Big Family Bust Up.
programme.desc: One-off edition in which the High Court enforcement agents are caught in the crossfire of three bitter family disputes, including a debt-dodging man who pushes his panic-stricken mother over the edge. Plus, a family booted onto the streets at night by a ruthless aunt, and a man who won't engage with the agents and loses his car.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Secrets and Lies.
programme.desc: Paul and Steve have an emotional confrontation in Berkshire when a tearful woman accuses her landlord of fleecing her for extra rent, while Brian and Del travel to Luton to recover £4,500 owed by an elusive debtor who has been giving them the runaround.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on people on benefits in the West Midlands. They include single mum-of-five Emma, who needs income support to help feed her children - but cannot afford their school uniforms - and 29-year-old Antonio, whose on-off work pattern has left him in debt, prompting him to seek help from his local MP to keep a roof over his head. Former Asbo kid Danny, now 21, is trying to put his criminal past behind him, and 59-year-old Teresa, just a few weeks off retirement, has been deemed unfit to work by her doctor - but the benefits office does not agree.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the experiences of welfare claimants in relationships. They include Essex couple Suzanne and Derek, who are looking to move to avoid paying bedroom tax on their four-bedroom home. But finding a property to meet Suzanne's exacting standards is proving tricky. Meanwhile, epilepsy sufferer Stephan and his wife Linda are deep in debt but still spend £12 a week feeding the homeless, and Carl and Angie's benefits are affected by his disability allowance and her wages from a part-time job.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. The Bentleys from Lincolnshire trade places with the Carter-Begbie family from Stamford. The Bentleys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a large four-bedroom house with three bathrooms, two reception rooms, a top-of-the-range kitchen, conservatory and games room. The Carter-Begbies live in a rented three-bedroom house and have a weekly budget of £140. This week, however, that will rise to almost £1,800.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: A bride-to-be addicted to diet pills, a tanning addict who is injecting himself with an unlicensed tanning drug he buys off the internet and a man suffering panic attacks.(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Genre-busting college classic with a career-best turn from John Belushi as the brew-swilling Bluto. Toga parties, drunken romance and sadistic army cadets: the film that broke the mould for teen comedy(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: Well-meaning but witless ex-con 'H' McDunnough causes pandemonium when he steals one of Arizona's famous newborn quintuplets for his infertile wife. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Hilariously zany comedy staring Steve Martin as Dr. Michael Hfuhruhurr, a recent widower and successful brain surgeon who develops a meaningful relationship...with a bottled brain!(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Coming-of-age saga examining the sometimes torturous, sometimes rewarding high-school experience. The extremely talented Reece Daniel Thompson portrays a stuttering teen who joins the school's debate squad and falls in love with a female teammate (Anna Kendrick). Written and directed by Jeffrey Blitz, who chronicled spelling-bee competitions in the documentary "Spellbound." Blitz also overcame his own teenage stuttering problem. The soundtrack features music by the Violent Femmes(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway are a scream as two lifelong best friends who schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place (New York City's Plaza Hotel) and at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Produced by Tom Hanks, written by Aaron Sorkin, and directed by Mike Nichols, this adaptation of George Crile III's incendiary bestseller tells the remarkable story of the Texas congressman whose efforts to prevent the Red Army from overtaking Afghanistan eventually led to the collapse of the Soviet Union while simultaneously fueling the rise of radical Islam. In the early 1980s, a hastily assembled army of Afghan "freedom fighters" achieved the remarkable feat of fending off Soviet invaders despite the fact that the odds were overwhelmingly stacked against them. At the time, Texas congressman Charlie Wilson (Hanks) was a key member of the hugely powerful House Appropriations Committee. Illuminated to the specifics of this remarkable war by a high-profile Houston socialite, Wilson spearheaded an effort to provide hundreds of millions of dollars in weapons and training to the Mujahideen with more than a little help from brilliant but prickly CIA operative Gust Avrokotos(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress (Carey Mulligan) in 19th century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women organizing to obtain the vote(n)

programme.title: 25th Hour
programme.desc: The cops have caught up with crook Ed Norton, but he still has 24 hours of freedom before going to jail(n)

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: A serial killer starts killing teenagers in a small town. As the body count rises, one girl and her friends start contemplating the Rules of horror films(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson tunes-up Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" in this action flick about a contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other convicts, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Joan Allen, Ian McShane(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Ted (voice of Seth MacFarlane) ties the knot with Tami-Lynn (Jessica Barth), and recruits his best friend John (Mark Wahlberg) as a sperm donor in order to start a family in this sequel to the comedy hit about a teddy bear come to life. Later, when the Commonwealth of Massachusetts demands that Ted appear before a judge to prove he's a real person, the frisky bear and his pal vow to fight for their civil rights. Morgan Freeman and Amanda Seyfried co-star(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: An A-list actor and his posse of best buds navigate the perils and pleasures of Hollywood life(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Doses of radiation turn a mild-mannered scientist into an angry, uncontrollable monstrosity in this adaptation of the Marvel Comics series. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars in John Frankenheimer's film as Rudy Duncan, an incarcerated small-time crook who takes on his murdered cellmate's identity when he is released from jail. Using his new identity he manages to sleep with the ex-con's raunchy penpal, but things get more dangerous as her brother, thinking Rudy is a master criminal, attempts to recruit him in a major casino heist(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women in this sexy sequel(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: The final instalment in this hugely successful trilogy, takes place in Hollywood during production of "Stab 3, Return To Woodsboro". The production is a thriller which raises troubling questions about the events that terrified Woodsboro and continue to haunt Sidney Prescott. Three and a half years after leaving Windsor College, Sidney has settled in to a life of quiet seclusion in Northern Carolina. But that uneasy peace is shattered when terror erupts on the set of "Stab 3". Hotshot TV presenter Gale Weathers is called to the scene by the LAPD as the ultimate expert on the previous murders, and is reunited with Dewey. Will they survive to tell the tale this time?(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: This haunting psychological horror tale examines what happens when a respected astronaut returns to Earth after a near-fatal accident. His wife immediately senses that something is wrong and her fear is heightened when she subsequently becomes pregnant with twins. What exactly happened out there in the silence of space?(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Wall Street

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy Seal is shot dead while threatening to throw himself from the top of a building. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Comrades in Arms. In the conclusion of a two-part story, Hawkeye (Alan Alda) and Margaret (Loretta Swit) are forced to put aside their mutual animosity as they huddle together in an abandoned hut behind enemy lines. With artillery shells flying over their heads, the two antagonists gain mutual respect for one another--and as they wake up after a long night's sleep, it appears that they have become far more than friends (if the sly, contented look on Margaret's face is any indication). Meanwhile, B.J. (Mike Farrell) hires a helicopter and conducts a frenzied search for the missing couple(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The Merchant of Korea. Charles (David Ogden Stiers) lends money to Hawkeye (Alan Alda) and B.J. (Mike Farrell), but only on condition that they perform a variety of menial tasks for him. Before long, Charles has become the 4077's "favorite" loan shark, exacting servitude from virtually everyone in camp. But with the help of Radar (Gary Burghoff), Charles meets his Waterloo--or should we say "whistle-loo"?--during a mammoth poker game(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The Smell of Music. Sorely annoyed when Charles (David Ogden Stiers) insists upon playing his French horn incessantly, Hawkeye (Alan Alda) and B.J. (Mike Farrell) issue an ultimatum: Either Charles ceases and desists, or they will refuse to take showers. Before long, the unbathed Hawk and Beej have become so intolerable that they have been "exiled" from the 4077th's mess hall--and practically everywhere else. Ultimately, the feud is settled with a torrent of cold water and a well-calculated "traffic accident", but not before Col. Potter (Harry Morgan) has tackled the more serious issue of a suicidal patient. With this episode, M*A*S*H settled into its fabled Monday-night timeslot, where it would play to spectacular ratings for the next five years(n)

programme.desc: Tough gangster kid Malik 'The Ghost' Bishop swaps street crime for life as a hitman. Ordered to ice the boss' girlfriend, he finds himself falling for her and planning to quit gangland. But there's going to be bloodshed before they let him go. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Village of the Damned
programme.desc: An American village is visited by an unkown life form which leaves the women of the village pregnant. Nine months later the babies are born and their parents soon realise that they are not quite human(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas and tearing apart his letter to Santa, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro and Edward Norton team up in this tense caper about the daring heist of a priceless artifact of European royalty, but bickering among the principals threatens to precipitate a coup before the theft gets under way. Frank Oz directed. Angela Bassett, Gary Farmer, Jamie Harrold, Paul Soles(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Maverick cop Dirty Harry Callahan is unimpressed with his new partner Kate Moore. But the pair must try to put their differences aside in order to tackle the People's Revolutionary Strike Force, an underground terrorist group who have stolen a truckload of weapons from an arms storehouse and are threatening to blow the city to smithereens unless their demands are met(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A futuristic cyborg is sent to present-day Los Angeles to assassinate a woman, who will bear the child who will someday save humanity(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: Awakening from a mysterious blackout, college professor Miranda Hollander finds herself surrounded by a mass of mutilated bodies, and is horrified to discover that she is a half-human/half-alien clone. Worried that she will soon be unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with a horde of murderous hybrids on her trail, it will be only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Chilling mystery starring Kevin Bacon, based on a novel by cult author Richard Matheson. After being hypnotised, a man starts experiencing disturbing visions of a ghostly girl(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: A boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground during a family trip to the Grand Canyon in this skin-crawling tale of terror. He takes five sacred stones from there back home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish caper film(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: A former British Special Forces agent now delivers cargo, no questions asked, in the south of France, but soon finds himself mixed up in a slave-trade ring(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: Debut feature from master of suspense and horror Stephen King. This sci-fi horror thriller stars Emilio Estevez as a convict on probation holed up in a truck stop as machines brought to life by a passing comet go on the rampage. For company he has a variety of mismatched characters including Pat Hingle as a redneck and Laura Harrington as a hitchhiker(n)

programme.desc: Tight-knit gang of street racers battle a new nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: The Gathering Storm. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents, modern colourisation techniques, state-of-the-art satellite-delivered terrain mapping and graphics. In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power. When Britain, France and the United States failed to confront initial acts of aggression, contempt for their weakness prompted Germany and Italy to intervene in the civil war in Spain and Hitler to make a series of land grabs which brought Europe to the brink of war. Ep. 1 (Followed by News)(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: Lightning War. Germany's use of the blitzkrieg, which caught Poland, France and Britain unprepared. Included: Germany's defeat of France; the British escape from Dunkirk(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: Britain at Bay. After the retreat from Dunkirk, Churchill rallied Britain in its darkest hour. Hitler was only just across the channel, but he reckoned without our supreme strategist, the might of the navy and the manoeuvrability of the air force. Crucially, Britain now had radar and the Enigma code had been broken. After the Battle of Britain, Churchill commenced the fight back(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color

programme.desc: New Frontiers. Tia opens a satellite shelter when Villalobos hits maximum capacity, a rescued puppy must be rushed to the vet with a severe sunburn and a skin infection, and Tania and Perry go to New York to perform a home check with a potential adoptee named Mittens(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix

programme.desc: Deadly Diet. An x-ray provides crucial evidence in an investigation into a case of three starving dogs. Investigator AJ confronts the owner with what her animals have been eating(n)

programme.desc: Cop Cat. Twelve cats are rescued from a hoarder's house; six dogs are seized from a house after their owner is evicted; and a feral cat with an injured paw is saved and finds a home in the Gilbert Police Department(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Puppies in a Pipe. A neglected dog with a leg injury is rescued; a mother and nine puppies are found in a storm drain; three kittens and their mother get a lifesaving operation(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Chain Break. An underweight Rottweiler is chained in the blazing sun; a search is on for kittens trapped under roof tiles; a dog that was attacked by coyotes fights for its life(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Shifting Gears. A long list of suspects is attached to a stolen ATV; Carter responds to a case of domestic violence; a sting is planned to catch a night hunter(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Buck Fever. The final week of deer season makes some hunters desperate to bag a buck. Meanwhile, a felon with an illegal gun and a pile of bait is confronted; and teen hunters are terrorizing a neighborhood(n)

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Homecoming. The wardens find closure to one of the most enduring mysteries in their organization's history. Also: a look back at their years of service(n)

programme.desc: Alligator Showdown. A man raising alligators in his attic is investigated; a nighttime search is launched to rescue a group of lost hikers(n)

programme.desc: Hunting the Hunters. An elderly man with dementia has gone missing in a swamp near Whitefield; an aggressive and angry hunter is encountered during an investigation of a road-hunting complaint(n)

programme.desc: Manhunt. Officers assist police in tracking a breaking-and-entering suspect. Also: an ATV accident; an injured loon(n)

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Olia Hercules and Frederick Forster and wine expert Jane Parkinson. With clips from Rick Stein, The Spice Men, Nigella Lawson and The Hairy Bikers.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.sub-title: When You Want to Show Off.
programme.desc: Mary and her husband celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary, and she shares her secrets on how to create surprisingly easy showstoppers, including canapes inspired by the 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker is joined by Martin Keown and Jermaine Jenas to preview this weekend's fixtures. Plus, interviews with Harry Maguire, Jordan Pickford, Tom Davies and Mark Warburton.(n)

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: France v Great Britain: Day Two.
programme.desc: France v Great Britain. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the second day of the World Group quarter-final, featuring the doubles rubber at the Kindarena in Rouen. Britain are aiming to reach the semi-finals for the third successive year, and this clash is likely to be decisive in deciding the victors.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a music edition of the celebrity general knowledge quiz, with contestants Mick Foster, Tony Allen, Pauline Black, Harvey, Jonathan Ansell, Faryl Smith, Lee Latchford-Evans and Michelle Heaton trying to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Game show in which Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Connie makes an effort to show how much she cares on Grace's birthday, but Grace rejects her, and David returns for his first day back at work with his resignation letter for Jacob. Meanwhile, Robyn worries there is something wrong with baby Charlotte, but Duffy and Charlie reassure her it is just a minor cough.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Actor-turned-documentarian Ross Kemp joins Agnes in her studio lounge, where his survival skills are put to the test. Chef Aly whips up another culinary storm as comedian Kevin Bridges - and his mother Patricia - join him in the kitchen for another installment of The Cathy Brown Show, and wildlife expert Steve Backshall may have cause to regret joining Dermot and Buster's Celebrity Safari. Plus, another Thought for the Day from Father Damien and Father Trevor, and Pixie Lott closes the show, performing her new song Baby.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Chelsea at the Vitality Stadium and Manchester City v Hull City at the Etihad Stadium. The Cherries were aiming to avoid being dragged into the battle to avoid the drop, but had their work cut out against the champions-elect.(n)

programme.title: I Am Number Four
programme.desc: A teenager with special powers is forced to live as a fugitive, constantly moving from place to place with his protector to avoid aliens who seek to destroy him. His nomadic existence is threatened when he falls in love, just as he begins to realise the origin of his extraordinary abilities. Sci-fi thriller, starring Alex Pettyfer, Timothy Olyphant and Teresa Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Chelsea at the Vitality Stadium and Manchester City v Hull City at the Etihad Stadium. The Cherries were aiming to avoid being dragged into the battle to avoid the drop, but had their work cut out against the champions-elect.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents a discussion from Netherhall School, Cambridge of gender-neutral language, trading with countries that abuse human rights, and the meaning of Easter.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Helen and Simon Holroyd sample life in Australia for a week to find out if a move there might help save their relationship, which is under strain from Simon's heavy work schedule. Nicki Chapman presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott travels to Oswestry Showground, Shropshire, where two teams of dancers compete to seek out the best bargains and sell their discoveries for a profit at auction. Christina Trevanion and Kate Bliss are on hand to offer expert advice on the choice buys.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a terrace in Carlisle in Cumbria, a detached house in Long Eton, Nottinghamshire, and a flat in London's East Ham.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Giving toads a helping hand to reach their natural habitat, Cumbrian communities' work to recover from the winter floods, and Paul Martin's tips on building a watery wildlife haven.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team travels to Winchester, where Christina Trevanion and James Lewis join Paul Martin to value items brought in by the public, including a brooch, Etruscan pottery and a maritime journal. Paul also visits the Winchester School of Arts.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on the Dorset coast with a couple hoping to find literary inspiration and seaside serenity for their £500,000 budget. She also meets a pair of inspired printmakers.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby visits a farm in the Yorkshire Dales during lambing season, and the Archbishop of York meets a woman who forgave those responsible for her son's death.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team continue to explore the archipelago, much of which still remains a mystery to science. The presenter ventures far beneath the waves in a deep-sea submersible in search of an elusive ocean giant, the mola or sunfish, to understand more about its little-known behaviour. She also sees how sea lions have been affected by the El Nino weather phenomenon, before the team sails north for the most remote and inhospitable islands in the Galapagos - Wolf and Darwin, where Liz helps tag and track hammerhead sharks that school at this location.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team are in Holderness in the east Riding of Yorkshire, where Matt Baker and Anita Rani visit Spurn Island, an area separated from the mainland by the storm surge of 2013. Matt meets a lifeboat crew, while Anita goes in search of the island's wildlife. John Craven meets a photographer documenting farming communities on Sunk Island, while Adam Henson and Tom Heap report on dairy farming.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Pembroke Castle in South Wales, where objects brought in to be valued include a collection of intimate photographs charting the last days of the imprisoned Russian royal family in 1917, and a stick pin presented to one of George V's servants. A dairy maid demonstrates how to use a butter maker with a connection to Queen Victoria.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Kate is approached by another woman who claims to have been assaulted by Michael Farmer. Combined with the new forensic evidence casting doubt over Tim Ifield, the revelation threatens to undermine AC-12 team's case, to Steve's fury. However, it gives Kate the opportunity to ingratiate herself further with the officers of Operation Trapdoor. Steve challenges Roz's husband to vouch for her whereabouts on the night Tim Ifield disappeared, and sees a new direction for the investigation when he proves evasive.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the latest Premier League action, featuring Sunderland v Manchester United at the Stadium of Light and Everton v Leicester City at Goodison Park. Sunderland have been at their best in the final months of the season in recent years, and need to be once again if they are to pull off an impressive escape from the relegation places.(n)

programme.title: I'm Different: Let Me Drive
programme.desc: The stories of two learner drivers on the autistic spectrum. Chris from Bournemouth has Asperger's syndrome, and wants to be able to drive so he can spend more time with his girlfriend - but he fears unpredictable situations, which makes him overly cautious behind the wheel. London resident Cannadine finds it hard maintaining concentration.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Secret of the Wings
programme.desc: The fairy becomes curious about the mysterious winter forest where fairies never dare to go. She travels into the cold woods, where she meets a new friend and uncovers a threat to both their homes that they must work together to prevent. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Lucy Hale, Anjelica Huston and Timothy Dalton.(n)

programme.title: G-Force
programme.desc: A team of secret-agent guinea pigs armed with hi-tech gadgets is sent on a mission to stop an evil billionaire taking over the world. However, before the rodents can complete their mission, they end up on sale in a pet shop. Children's adventure, starring Bill Nighy, with the voices of Sam Rockwell, Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Ambitious fish Oscar dreams of escaping his humdrum undersea life. His wish comes true when a gangster shark keen to escape a world of organised crime seeks his help in faking his own death. But Oscar soon finds himself out of his depth as his fearsome reputation gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Smith, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Renee Zellweger, Angelina Jolie and Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: The Bat Man of Mexico.
programme.desc: Since he first kept vampire bats in his bathroom as a child, Mexican biologist and ecologist Rodrigo Medellin has dedicated his life to saving all species of the flying mammal. In this film, David Attenborough narrates his quest to save the endangered lesser long-nosed bat, which is crucial to the production of tequila as it pollinates the plants the drink is made from. Medellin tracks the bats' epic migration across Mexico - braving hurricanes, snakes, Mayan tombs and seas of cockroaches.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a neglected house in Knotty Ash, Liverpool, a near showroom-condition property in Aberdare, south Wales, and a former shop in Glasgow.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives a masterclass in poaching, one of his favourite techniques, because of the way it conserves and enhances the flavours of delicate ingredients while keeping them in perfect shape. He starts with a simple poached egg and tomato fondue, then demonstrates how to make chicken with morel mushrooms cooked with vin jaune wine from his native Jura region in France, before preparing a dessert of poached peach with peach granita.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on items suitable for picnics, including Paul Hollywood's quail's egg pork pies.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Highlights: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents action from the second day at the Augusta National in Georgia. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Andrew Cotter and Paul Azinger.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Rolling Stones autographs cause excitement at an antiques fair in Winchester and expert Christina Trevanion develops a fondness for an old teddy bear. James Lewis finds ceramic sheep slightly disturbing, and presenter Paul Martin visits Chawton House to explore the link between author Jane Austen and an American millionaire.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The University of Edinburgh takes on Balliol College, Oxford, in the second semi-final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the final, in which the two most successful teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked. One set of clues comprises The Property of a Lady, The Hildebrand Rarity, Risico and 007 in New York. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he adds some summer flowering bulbs. As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: France v Great Britain: Day Two.
programme.desc: France v Great Britain. Sue Barker introduces further coverage of the second day of the World Group quarter-final, featuring the doubles rubber at the Kindarena in Rouen.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Mashpi Lodge in Ecuador, which is 900 metres above sea level and features a gondola cable car that transports guests a mile through the rainforest canopy. The pair reveal the challenges of delivering the highest standards of experience in the midst of teeming wildlife, mud and moisture, as well as the eco-tourism that is saving thousands of species, and also spend time with their new co-workers at home, hearing moving stories of how local people's lives have been transformed by the arrival of the hotel.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The giant armadillo, an animal so elusive few have ever seen it wild in the Brazilian wetlands region known as the Pantanal. David Attenborough reveals how the burrows the armadillos dig create homes for hundreds of other animals. Until recently man knew virtually nothing of this species, but Arnaud Desbiez, the founder of the Giant Armadillo Project, has changed all that.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Live: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the third day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the opening Major of the year continues. Jordan Spieth was the defending champion here last year and seemed destined to retain his crown as he led at the end of the third round, meaning he topped the leaderboard at The Masters for a seventh consecutive round, making it a new tournament record. However, a disappointing round of one-over par saw him finish day three just one stroke clear of compatriot Smylie Kaufman, who himself had carded a three-under 69, and was chasing his first Major success. Meanwhile, Bernhard Langer was the leading European contender on an overall score of one-under, and Danny Willett was tied for fifth alongside Jason Day and Dustin Johnson, though few would have expected the man from Sheffield to claim the first Major of his career as Spieth collapsed on day four. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Paul Azinger and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: Ilo Ilo
programme.desc: A couple in Singapore employ a Filipino immigrant as a maid. While they initially struggle with having a stranger in the house, she ultimately becomes a firm friend to her employers and particularly to their troubled son. However, a financial crisis leaves her facing an uncertain future. Drama, starring Yann Yann Yeo and Tian Wen Chen. In Mandarin, Tagalog, English and Hokkien.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.sub-title: The Times They Are a Changing.
programme.desc: Rosie Guille organises a visit from a group of respected artists to capture the beauty of the island and highlight conservation issues. Methodist lay preacher Karen Le Mouton has dedicated the past three years of her life to the people of Sark, but she and her congregation must come to terms with the idea she may have to leave to begin ordination training.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is keen to find out how hardy the plants are that she deliberately left in the ground last year to test their resilience over the winter months. She also visits a retired doctor who has created a fascinating topiary garden in Monymusk, Aberdeenshire. George Anderson takes a look at his winter stem border that's now full of plants, the glasshouse is a hive of activity as Jim McColl continues to sow, and Chris Beardshaw works on the pond area, planting a range of grasses on the banking.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: The horticultural tour continues with a trip to South Africa, one of the greenest zones in the world. In Cape Town, Monty Don visits the renowned Kirstenbosch Botanic Gardens, where he encounters the country's national plant, the king protea, and discovers an abundance of plant life in the Drakensberg mountains.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he adds some summer flowering bulbs. As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Reports on the UK's forests. Matt Baker helps out with an inventory of the New Forest's trees, and Ellie Harrison visits Inverness to take a look at industrial timber production and the impact of forestry on red squirrels. Sean Fletcher reports on the Scottish tradition of hutting, John Craven examines the revival of working with horses in forests, and Charlotte Smith discovers whether enough trees are being planted in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.sub-title: Triathlon World Series Highlights: 2017 ITU World Triathlon Series: Gold Coast.
programme.desc: Action from the second round of the ITU World Triathlon Series from Gold Coast in Australia, featuring the men's and women's races.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with a line-up of guests, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: France v Great Britain: Day Three.
programme.desc: France v Great Britain. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the third day of the World Group quarter-final, featuring the concluding two singles rubbers at the Kindarena in Rouen. This fixture features the two nations that just missed out on last year's final, with Britain losing to Argentina and France defeated by Croatia in their semi-finals. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Live: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the fourth day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the opening Major of the year concludes. Holder Jordan Spieth of America held the lead going into this stage in 2016, but England's Danny Willett came back from five shots down at the start of the final day last year, carding an impressive five-under-par 67 to win his maiden Major. Spieth eventually finished in second place alongside Willett's compatriot Lee Westwood on a day that was also notable for Shane Lowry, Davis Love III, and Louis Oosthuizen all making holes-in-one on the 16th. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Paul Azinger and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis travels through Central Asia. In Tajikistan, he meets the last survivors of the Sogdian people, a culture that proved vital to the success of the Silk Road and traded from the China Sea to the Mediterranean. He also visits the Uzbek cities of Samarkand and Bukhara, discovering how the conqueror Timur captured large numbers of craftsmen to build them, and discovers how trade between nations led to the birth of astronomy and modern mathematics.(n)

programme.title: Dust Storm
programme.desc: Documentary about the dangerous weather phenomena. The programme explores the Middle east, the part of the world most heavily affected by dust storms, and questions what causes them, the damage they can cause to people's health and how they can be prevented.(n)

programme.title: Wild Scotland
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan takes a trip home to the island of Mull where he has just one day to film the rare sea eagle. While searching for a nest site, he spots a host of other wildlife species.(n)

programme.title: Department Q: The Keeper Of Lost Causes
programme.desc: A police officer in disgrace after a disastrous shootout is reassigned to work on sorting unsolved case files. He refuses to stay deskbound, and he and his new assistant investigate the suspicious death of a politician five years previously. Murder mystery basded on Jussi Adler-Olsen's series of novels, starring Nikolaj Lie Kaas and Fares Fares. In Danish, Swedish and Arabic.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long introduce performances by KC and the Sunshine Band, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, the Lotus Eaters, Malcolm McLaren, Robert Plant and Bananarama.(n)

programme.title: Psychedelic Britannia
programme.desc: The rise and fall of arguably the most visionary period in British music history, when between 1965 and 1970 a handful of dreamers re-imagined pop music. The psychedelic era produced some of the most ground-breaking music ever made, pioneered by young improvising bands like Soft Machine and Pink Floyd, then quickly taken to the charts by the likes of the Beatles, Procol Harum, Small Faces and Moody Blues. This film, narrated by Nigel Planer, features contributions and freshly shot performances from artists who lived and breathed the psych revolution.(n)

programme.title: Totally 60s Psychedelic Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the genre from programmes such as Colour Me Pop, How It Is, Top of the Pops and Once More with Felix. Performers include Status Quo, the Incredible String Band, Donovan, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band, Julie Driscoll with Brian Auger and the Trinity, the Moody Blues, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Joe Cocker, the Move, Procol Harum, Cream, Jimi Hendrix and the Who.(n)

programme.title: Pink Floyd Beginnings 1967 - 1972
programme.desc: After The Dark Side of the Moon became a global smash in 1973, rock band Pink Floyd concentrated on the creative freedom of live performance, leaving the world of TV behind. Now, after painstaking research, tapes of some early historic appearances have been tracked down and compiled, offering an insight into Floyd's initial work, and providing clues as to the origins of their later material.(n)

programme.title: Psychedelic Britannia
programme.desc: The rise and fall of arguably the most visionary period in British music history, when between 1965 and 1970 a handful of dreamers re-imagined pop music. The psychedelic era produced some of the most ground-breaking music ever made, pioneered by young improvising bands like Soft Machine and Pink Floyd, then quickly taken to the charts by the likes of the Beatles, Procol Harum, Small Faces and Moody Blues. This film, narrated by Nigel Planer, features contributions and freshly shot performances from artists who lived and breathed the psych revolution.(n)

programme.title: Britain at War: Imperial War Museums at 100
programme.desc: Falklands War veteran and charity campaigner Simon Weston marks 100 years since the establishment of the Imperial War Museums, which were initially set up in 1917 - in the midst of the First World War - to pay tribute to civil and military sacrifices during times of conflict. First housed at the Crystal Palace in London, over the past century, the organisation has expanded, comprising five sites across Britain. In this programme Weston examines 10 key objects from the IWM's collection, with help from special `advocates' who explore each artefact's story. Includes contributions by Bear Grylls, Al Murray, Cornelia Parker, Steve McQueen, Kate Adie, Kelly Holmes and Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Tommies
programme.desc: Fergal Keane explores some of the most powerful stories of Britain's boy soldiers, with as many as 250,000 under-18s having served in the British Army during the First World War and every 10th volunteer lying about his age. The journalist examines what made them enlist and finds out how they coped with the reality of war, and looks at how there was a movement in Britain to get them home as casualties began to mount. He also meets the children and grandchildren of veterans, taking them on an emotional journey to the places where their ancestors trained and fought.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The work of scientists trying to understand why the world's weather seems to be getting more extreme and if these patterns are a taste of what is to come. In the past few years, the UK has experienced very cold winters, drought and floods, while in Texas an unprecedented amount of rainfall has been followed by a record-breaking dry period.(n)

programme.title: Folk Awards 2017: Highlights
programme.desc: Performances and memorable moments from the folk music event, hosted by Mark Radcliffe and Julie Fowlis from the Royal Albert Hall. Among the artists performing are Ry Cooder, Afro Celt Sound System, Al Stewart, Billy Bragg, Shirley Collins, Jim Moray, Fara and Daoiri Farrell, and there are appearances by Ray Davies, Sharleen Spiteri and Nick Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A thoughtful and intimate feature-length portrait of the rock musician, following her shopping for clothes in Paris, hanging out with Sandra Bernhard in New York, spending time in London and taking a special trip back to her home town of Akron, Ohio. The documentary also features Chrissie giving a live performance at one of London's newest venues.(n)

programme.title: Delivery Man
programme.desc: An aging slacker and former sperm donor discovers that he is the biological father of 533 children, and that 142 of them have filed a lawsuit to learn his true identity in this Dreamworks comedy starring Vince Vaughn. Aside from the fact that he was a regular visitor at a fertility clinic 20 years ago, there's nothing particularly remarkable about David Wozniak (Vince Vaughn): He drives a meat-delivery truck for his father's butcher business, he can't seem to hold down a relationship, and lately he's taken to growing marijuana as a means of paying off an $80,000 debt. He's so inept at even the simplest things that his girlfriend Emma (Cobie Smulders) can't stand the sight of him after she reveals that she's pregnant with his child. When an attorney tracks David down and reveals that he is the biological father of 533 children, and that 142 of them have filed a lawsuit to learn his true identity, the former donor panics, recruiting his lawyer friend Brett (Chris Pratt) to defend the privacy agreements he signed at the clinic. When Brett returns with an envelope containing profiles of all 142 children named in the lawsuit, however, David can't help but look, and before long he's surreptitiously injecting himself into the lives of his unsuspecting offspring. Meanwhile, as he begins to grow excited at the prospect of having his own child, he finds that sometimes the best fathers are the men who seem the least fit for parenting(n)

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: Trying to salvage their marriage, Jason and Cynthia invite three other couples to join them on a couple's retreat at a tropical island resort. The others reluctantly agree, planning to have fun while Jason and Cynthia go through therapy with an island psychologist. programme.title: Jim Nantz Remembers Augusta: Arnold Palmer--His Last Visit to the Masters
programme.desc: For the first Masters since the passing of legend Arnold Palmer, Jim Nantz relives Palmer's years at Augusta National, beginning with his first victory in 1958 through his emotional final walk to the 18th green in 2004. programme.desc: Episode 313. Products include an elevated monorail bike system from the inventor of Rollerblades; accessories that convert shoes into boots; a custom-made air mattress; and customized cruiser bikes. Also: an update on a towel designed for modesty when changing(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 312. Pitches in the Season 3 finale include a residential lock system that incorporates a key into a mobile phone; a home gym with nitrogen-gas pressure as resistance; antiaging products inspired by their developer's older girlfriend; and recycled sneakers. Also: an update on a Web site that sells VIP treatment at nightclubs and special events(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 406. NFL player Brandon Jacobs helps a New Jersey woman pitch her protein-infused energy drink; cousins from Maine look for backing for their lobster-roll food truck; a California couple shares the secret ingredient to their eco-friendly cleaning products; and a North Carolina man explains what makes his drink insulators special. Also: an update on a Season 3 lip-balm product invested in by Mark Cuban(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 703. Talent manager Troy Carter, the founder, chairman and CEO of Atom Factory, appears as a "guest shark." Included: A duo from Dallas pitch their eclectic sock of the month club subscription; an entrepreneur from Springdale, Md., has a valet and garage parking app; and parents tout the benefits of their grippy balm that keeps eyeglasses from slipping. Also: a look back at several of Kevin O'Leary's past deals(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 715. A Shark declares one pitchperson would drive them nuts. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 501. Billionaire businessman and philanthropist John Paul DeJoria appears as a guest Shark; and Daymond John declares one pitch the worst of all time. Also: an update on a product from Season 4 that helps to safely clean stuffed animals(n)

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession.(n)

So far, only nine rooms have been renovated and many areas of the 12-acre estate have yet to be looked at - but the project is going to have to start paying for itself soon. They make plans to host weddings on the grounds, while looking ahead to keeping livestock and growing their own crops. Dick takes steps to generate solar power during a hot summer, and turns an old oil tank into a pig roaster.(n)

She discovers the daily routine of the household staff during a royal visit, and flicks through a scrapbook of mementos dating back to 1925, which provides an insight into how life in the royal family has changed over the years. She also meets the Queen's bugler, finds an unexpected treasure from the 1953 coronation tour and discovers how in 2012, the Queen played a simple but vital role in uniting two fractured communities in Enniskillen simply by crossing the road.(n)
