programme.desc: Premiere. A turkey given the traditional Thanksgiving pardon by the President of the United States gets dragged into an audacious plan to change American history. A rogue bird hijacks a time machine and takes them both back to pilgrim times on a mission to prevent turkeys becoming the traditional holiday meal. Animated comedy, with the voices of Owen Wilson and Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: A man's single-minded pursuit of a legendary treasure takes its toll on his marriage and his wife decamps for a new life on board the yacht of a globe-trotting billionaire. But the bickering pair reunite when a new clue to the whereabouts of the elusive fortune emerges, and they enlist the help of the wife's new boss to help them find it. Romantic comedy adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Kate Hudson, Donald Sutherland and Ray Winstone. Edited for violence, language, sexual content and nudity. Includes 5 News Update at 4.35pm.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Playful Pups Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring puppies doing bizarre and humorous things.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: When Chat Shows Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford narrates a compilation of talk show disasters. The programme features Eamonn Holmes' infamous interview with a monosyllabic David Blaine, Spike Milligan causing mayhem on Wogan, Joan Rivers launching into a rant at guest Brigitte Nielsen, and Katrina Buchanan enduring a succession of technical issues while appearing on a live Irish chat show.(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot races to rescue his estranged daughter after a huge earthquake hits California(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: A gay couple, Armand and Albert, are challenged to play it straight when Armand's son brings home his fiancée---the daughter of an ultraconservative senator. Robin Williams, Nathan Lane, Gene Hackman, Dianne Wiest, Dan Futterman, Calista Flockhart, Hank Azaria, Christine Baranski, Tom McGowan, Grant Heslov, James Lally, Luca Tommassini, Tim Kelleher, J. Roy Helland(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: The randy spy must travel back to the swinging sixties to retrieve his mojo after it is stolen by one of Dr. Evil's more revolting henchmen. Gloriously funny comedy starring Mike Myers(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: A hugely popular rapper faces a career meltdown when his latest album tanks and his attempts to rehab his image only end in disaster. In time, he considers reuniting with his old rap trio, the Style Boyz, in this hysterical, fast-paced mockumentary(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: In this amusing fish-out-of-water workplace comedy, a 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company. Later, he unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: The true story of prominent mathematician John Forbes Nash Jr. is the subject of this biographical drama from director Ron Howard. Russell Crowe stars as the brilliant but arrogant and conceited professor Nash. The prof seems guaranteed a rosy future in the early '50s after he marries beautiful student Alicia (Jennifer Connelly) and makes a remarkable advancement in the foundations of "game theory," which carries him to the brink of international acclaim. Soon after, John is visited by Agent William Parcher (Ed Harris), from the CIA, who wants to recruit him for code-breaking activities. But evidence suggests that Nash's perceptions of reality are cloudy at best; he is struggling to maintain his tenuous hold on sanity, and Alicia suspects a diagnosis of paranoid schizophrenia. Battling decades of illness with the loyal Alicia by his side, Nash is ultimately able to gain some control over his mental state, and eventually goes on to triumphantly win the Nobel Prize. Based loosely on the book of the same name by Sylvia Nasar, A Beautiful Mind (2001) co-stars Paul Bettany, Adam Goldberg, Anthony Rapp, Christopher Plummer, and Judd Hirsch(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalize Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding installment in the dystopian young-adult series, Thomas and the other Gladers journey across an obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the organization known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The star (Mel Gibson) and writer (Randall Wallace) of "Braveheart" reunited for this powerful war epic based on a true story. Gibson plays Lt. Col. Hal Moore, who leads U.S. troops into one of the first and bloodiest battles in Vietnam in November 1965. Madeleine Stowe, Sam Elliott, Greg Kinnear, Chris Klein, Barry Pepper, Keri Russell(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: A disfigured outcast forms a close bond with an emotionally neglected 12-year-old. Based on the novel by Isabelle Holland(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A young journalist must investigate a mysterious videotape which seems to cause the death of anyone in a week of viewing it(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: Adriana is a 13-year-old girl from Mexico City whose kidnapping by sex traffickers sets in motion a desperate mission by her 17-year-old brother, Jorge, to save her(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When an aircraft crash-lands in the Sahara, one of the survivors, a German designer, draws up a plan to build a glider from the wreckage, but the expected conflicts beneath the oppressive heat, make their chances of success seem slim at best in this dramatic adventure(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor turned drama teacher attempts to make a splash by staging a controversial sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Hilariously zany comedy staring Steve Martin as Dr. Michael Hfuhruhurr, a recent widower and successful brain surgeon who develops a meaningful relationship...with a bottled brain!(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Carol Fuchs adapts writer/director Sandra Nettelbeck's screenplay for the 2001 romantic drama Mostly Martha for this Scott Hicks directed remake starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, Aaron Eckhart, and Patricia Clarkson. Kate Armstrong (Jones) is the master chef who is equally intense both in and out of the kitchen. Though Kate's "Type A" personality serves her well when whipping up meals in the trendy Manhattan eatery where she has made a name for herself, it threatens to sink her when she is named as the guardian of her nine-year-old niece Zoe (Little Miss Sunshine's Abigail Breslin). To complicate matters, an impetuous new sous chef named Nick Palmer (Eckhart) has recently joined the kitchen staff and his freewheeling personality seems to stand in direct opposition to Kate's unwavering perfectionism. Yet, despite the fact that they couldn't be more different on the surface, there's no denying the strong attraction between Kate and Nick. As the rivalry between the competitive cooks gradually gives way to romance, the lessons learned by compromising in the kitchen reveal to Kate the importance of learning to openly express herself in order to truly connect with Zoe and find romance with the good-natured Nick(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman find love in the Outback in Baz Luhrmann's sweeping drama(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kristen Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: A Swedish man opts for a sex change and undergoes the world's first gender reassignment surgery, but his marriage suffers as his artist wife struggles with the transition(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: Ron Howard helms this adaptation of Nathaniel Philbrick's historical novel about the harrowing high-seas encounter that inspired Herman Melville's Moby Dick. In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days. Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, and Brendan Gleeson co-star(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the third and equally fun entry in the popular pulp-adventure series, Rick O'Connell (Brendan Fraser) and wife, Evelyn (Maria Bello), find themselves in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex (Luke Ford), and, of course, a troublesome mummy. This time he's a centuries-old Chinese emperor (Jet Li) with a vast undead army. Michelle Yeoh, Jonathan Carnahan, Zi Juan(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.sub-title: Not Going Out Christmas Special: The House.
programme.desc: Lee wants to create the perfect Christmas for Lucy, so he invites her to spend the holiday in a cosy old country house that used to belong to his dear, dead old aunt - and to make it a proper family get-together, he invites along her parents and dipsy friend Daisy. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix star in this festive special of the sitcom, with Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant. Festive edition from 2013.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: First Steps. Young animals take on the challenges of the wild world that surrounds them in this series. Included in the opener: Meerkat pups leave their burrows for the first time; barnacle geese learn to fly; humpback whales protect their young from sharks(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: Growing Up. David Attenborough explores how animals attempt to overcome the challenges that face them at each of the six crucial stages of life as they strive towards ultimate success - passing on their genes. This episode follows animals as they grow up in the adult world, developing new skills and learning how to survive on their own. A tiger cub grows up in a very dangerous society. She needs the support of both parents if she is to become an independent adult, but the appearance of a rival to her father may change everything. The veined octopus spends almost all of its time feeding as it races towards adulthood, but this leaves it exposed to predators. In order to protect itself it searches for bits of discarded coconut shell that will fit neatly together. Then it uses them as protective armor. A pair of young cheetah siblings are in a race against starvation. They can only survive by working together to bring down big prey for the first time - an impala weighing more than both cheetahs put together(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: Home. A look at how animals build and maintain their homes. Included: African hunting dogs; hermit crabs; mountain goats; grizzly bears; pikas; weaver ants; and chimpanzees(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Heaton's first suspect provides an alibi for one of the cold case murders and finds himself in the clear as forensic evidence establishes that all three girls were killed in the same manner. Desperate for his freedom, he cooperates with the police by identifying everyone involved in staging the rave events attended by the victims. When the real killer is named, the race is on to find him before he strikes again. James Gaddas guest stars.(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds' nests to the death's-head hawkmoth stealing honey.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that `talk' to bees using electrical signals.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth.
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.(n)

programme.title: Outback Rangers
programme.desc: The team members protect crocodile eggs and investigate reports of prehistoric art. Documentary strand following rangers at Kakadu National Park in Australia.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities

programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: Lovelorn Ben Stiller hires sleazy investigator Matt Dillon to track down high school sweetheart Cameron Diaz. Gross-out gag fest. Contains strong language/sexual scenes(n)

programme.title: Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
programme.desc: Tuneful, fun-filled romp parodying musical biopics. John C. Reilly stars as an Alabama singer who swings with the times and covers all genres in his up-and-down five-decade career. Jenna Fischer, Tim Meadows. Directed by Jake Kasdan, who co-wrote the script with Judd Apatow, and who also contributed songs to the soundtrack, along with Marshall Crenshaw and Van Dyke Parks(n)

programme.title: The Anniversary Party
programme.desc: (2001) Alan Cumming and Jennifer Jason Leigh wrote, produced and directed The Anniversary Party , still finding the energy to star as Joe and Sally Therrian, a Hollywood couple celebrating their sixth anniversary. He's a writer trying his hand at directing, she's an actress who's feeling time catching up with her. Invited to the party are a host of friends from their demi-monde, including Kevin Kline as Cal Gold, no longer first call when a rom-com leading man is needed; and Gwyneth Paltrow as Skye Davidson, a rising young star. Also invited are the Therrians' neighbours Ryan and Monica Rose (Denis O'Hare and Mina Badie) who have nothing in common with the gathering of once bright young things. But as the night progresses and drink and drugs begin to take effect, truths are revealed, old enmities expressed and sexual scores settled in a cool, intelligent film that is about smart people whose lives are ruined by having to act dumb(n)

programme.title: Roll Bounce
programme.desc: Xavier Smith , known to his friends as X, is a teenager growing up on the South Side of Chicago in the late '70s. X and his buddies are the hotshot skaters at the Palisades Gardens, a neighbourhood roller rink where local kids roll to the latest disco sounds, but X loses his status as king of the hill when the Palisades closes down(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A scrawny rat named Remy (voice of Patton Oswalt) finds his dreams of culinary superstardom stirring up sizable controversy in the kitchen of a fine French restaurant in director Brad Bird's madcap computer-animated comedy. It's hard being a rat with culinary aspirations, but Remy is convinced he has what it takes to break the stereotypes and follow in the footsteps of star chef Auguste Gusteau (voice of Brad Garrett). As fate would have it, Remy is currently situated in the sewers directly beneath Gusteau's elegant restaurant. Soon Remy teams up with a young chef with little talent named Linguini (voice of Lou Romano). Together they are able to create some fabulous dishes, but they live in fear that someone will discover their secret and object strenuously to a rat being in a kitchen. When Remy's passion for cooking turns the haughty world of French cuisine upside down, the rat who would be king of the kitchen learns important lessons about life, friends, and family while questioning whether he should pursue his culinary calling or simply go back underground and return to his life as a sewer rat(n)

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Billy Chapel has played 19 seasons with the Detroit Tigers. But his throwing arm is not what it was, and his team owner tells him that if he doesn't retire after the last game, he will be traded. In his final moments on the pitcher's mound, Chapel thinks back over his lifelong romance with his girl and the game(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Rafting expert Gail takes on a pair of armed killers while navigating a spectacularly violent river(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese re-creates the mean streets of Manhattan in this historical epic set in the 1860s. Daniel Day-Lewis is a brutal gang leader; Leonardo DiCaprio, a victim's son(n)

programme.desc: In this sequel to the comedy Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo, the bewildered, amusing, irresistible Deuce Bigalow (Rob Schneider) is invited over to Amsterdam by his friend, T.J. Hicks. After several boys in the program have been killed in the city, T.J. is accused of being the serial killer. It is up to Deuce to help him prove his innocence. While attending secret gigolo society meetings, the hero causes great confusion and, in addition, falls in love with a beautiful model(n)

programme.desc: Larry the Cable Guy "gits-r-done" in this uproarious comedy about three lame-brained Army reservists who get shipped off to Iraq, but somehow wind up in the Mexican desert. Bill Engvall, DJ Qualls, Danny Trejo. Directed by C.B. Harding(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Ben Gates is off on another thrilling treasure hunt in this action-packed sequel involving a missing page from John Wilkes Booth's diary, which leads to a globe-trotting race to find an ancient city of gold(n)

programme.title: The War Wagon
programme.desc: A cowboy plots to steal a $500,000 gold shipment from an avaricious mine owner. Meanwhile, the man hired to kill the cowboy decides to go along with the robbery scheme(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: Matthew Broderick just wants free cable TV but instead gets a cable guy as an unwanted, new best friend(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: The story of the friendship that develops between a bright but awkward 12-year-old and a wayward man masquerading as a lone parent in a bid to seduce single mothers(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Dale Denton, a process server with a weed fixation, witnesses a murder and turns to his dealer, Saul, for support. The murderer is actually Saul's main drug supplier, and because of Saul's access to some extremely rare high-grade pot (called Pineapple Express) the two are quickly tracked down and put on the run(n)

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: A New England seaside town's tourist season is turned into a nightmare by a giant killer shark. The local police chief's efforts to protect the public are thwarted by the greedy mayor, forcing him to join forces with a grizzled fisherman and a marine biologist to hunt and kill the monster predator(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: Billed as one of the most expensive movies ever to come out of Europe, The Fifth Element is a gripping science fiction adventure in which Bruce Willis plays Korben Dallas, a jaded New York cab driver in the 23rd century whose life takes a turn for the dramatic when a beautiful young woman literally falls into his life. Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) is the 'Fifth Element', a being who represents all that is good in the universe. Every 5,000 years, a doorway between two parallel dimensions opens which allows the forces of darkness to strike back at the forces of good in this dimension. Only by assembling the five elements at the crucial moment can the forces of good overcome those of evil - Korben's new-found mission is to protect Leeloo from the evil Zorg (Gary Oldman) and his army of dog-like mercenaries, the Mangalores(n)

programme.title: Ghost Town Renegades
programme.desc: The Cheyenne Kid's out to stop a crook from cheating the owners of a gold mine. Lash La Rue, Al St. John, Jack Ingram, Jennifer Holt, William Fawcett(n)

programme.title: John Carpenter's Vampires
programme.desc: By night vampires rise from loamy graves in search of human prey. By day vampire slayer Jack Crow leads a contingent of Vatican mercenaries in a long-waged war against these enemies. After destroying a vampire nest in rural New Mexico, "Team Crow" is savagely ambushed during the victory celebration by the unholy Valek, a vicious 600 year old vampire. Valek is nearing the end of a long search for the elusive Berziers Cross, the implement of ritual that can give him and all vampires succeeding him omnipotent power to walk in the daylight(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the US president asks his old gamer pals to battle the invaders(n)

programme.desc: An insensitive slave trader is shipwrecked on an island, where he learns from the example of the natives(n)

programme.desc: Thriller set in 2047 about a missing spacecraft which turns up seven years after it disappeared, with the crew dead and a strange presence on board. programme.desc: This nerve-wracking chiller is about a crime-boss's bodyguard (D.J. Naylor) who must pull off one last bank job before he can get out of the business. When the caper goes awry, the robbers and their hostages find themselves trapped by mutant zombies who've escaped from an government institution where they were part of a military experiment. Luckily for those barricaded in the bank, a government official (Big Daddy Kane), who worked on the botched tests, comes to the rescue. For some of them(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

Leonidas is the king of ancient Sparta. The city is famous for its warrior philosophy, and Leonidas won't kneel to the demands of Persia's King Xerxes. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpson and Delilah. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) has never been happy about his premature baldness, and has tried a number of products that claim to restore hair growth, with no luck. However, when a new hair growth treatment called Dimoxinil goes on the market, Homer is eager to try it -- until he discovers a supply costs 1,000 dollars. Homer's pal Lenny (voice of Harry Shearer) suggests he simply falsify an insurance form from work to pay for the formula, and before long Homer's desire for hair overpowers his scruples and he gives it a try. To Homer's ecstatic surprise, the Dimoxinil works like a charm, and he discovers a full head of hair makes a profound difference in his life -- he's more confident, more enthusiastic in bed, and when his boss Mr. Burns (also voiced by Shearer) mistakes him for "a young go-getter," he's given a big promotion. Homer soon finds he's in over his head, but with the help of his selfless assistant Karl (voice of Harvey Fierstein), Homer looks like he's on the fast track to success at the Nuclear Power Plant. However, Smithers (also voiced by Shearer), Burns' right-hand man, resents Homer's status as Mr. Burns' new favorite employee, and is soon looking for a way to move Homer out of the picture. "Simpson and Delilah" was first broadcast on October 18, 1990(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin looks forward to his annual Austrian holiday with Anne, Howard and Hilda. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 19, 1984.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin suspects Paul will try to sabotage his vicars and tarts party. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Peter Egan and Penelope Wilton. First broadcast February 26, 1984.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Key moments in the career of Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett are recounted by combining clips of chat show appearances with sketches from their comedy series. Talking to the likes of David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, they discuss everything from their first meeting through to the very last TV programme they made together, give an insight into the inspiration behind some of their most famous sketches and what made them tick as a duo, and reveal why The Two Ronnies came to a premature end. Dawn French narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show, which includes sketches Patient, Wedding, Spoonerism and Hampton Wick.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Featuring Madeline Smith in spoof drama Hampton Wick, with Barker and Corbett paying homage to Gilbert and Sullivan in their grand musical finale.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Suspicious about the validity of Foggy's war stories, Compo and Clegg use an old school challenge to establish the truth. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Marina wants to deliver a giant cuddly panda as her birthday present to lover Howard, so ropes in the reluctant trio to help. Comedy, featuring a guest appearance by comedian Jim Bowen and starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Desperate to earn some cash, Compo reveals a musical talent after being endorsed by several artists in the area and sets out as a one-man band. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, Brian Wilde and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After a taste of the high life, Del-Boy and Rodney are back in Nelson Mandela House and back in business as Trotters Independent Traders. When they receive an invitation to a cross-Channel Navy reunion intended for dear-departed Uncle Albert, Del spies the opportunity to make a few quid on a booze cruise. The only problem is, Rodney is now the company's managing director and would never approve. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, John Challis and Tessa Peake-Jones star in the 2002 Christmas special.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie prepares for his birthday celebration - but suffers an accident while putting up the decorations and breaks his leg. Only Eddie's mates Spudgun and Dave Hedgehog show up at the party and it dawns on Richie that he has no real friends. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayell and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Filthy, Rich and Catflap
programme.desc: Richie plans to profit from his father's death by selling advertising rights for the funeral. When the old man recovers however, the comic takes matters into his own hands.(n)

programme.title: Filthy, Rich and Catflap
programme.desc: Richie is booked to appear on breakfast television but, as usual, his plan for stardom falls flat when he and Eddie are caught up in a national scandal. Anne Diamond guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: The comedian returns to the theme of charity, after failing to address it during the first episode of the series. He ponders whether people have a moral obligation to contribute, and how much money millionaires should give. With guest Armando Iannucci.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: Stewart Lee talks about stand-up comedy while sitting down and threatens to play a guitar to accompany his routine. With guest Armando Iannucci.(n)

programme.title: Steve Coogan: The Man Who Thinks He's It
programme.desc: Footage of the comedian's 1998 set at the Palace Theatre Manchester during his 200-date national tour, featuring characters including Alan Partridge, Paul and Pauline Calf, Tony Ferrino and Duncan Thicket. With Simon Pegg and Julia Davis.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is stuck at home while waiting to be called for jury service - but as time ticks on and his frustration grows, he begins to feel as if he is the one on trial. Richard Wilson stars in an episode featuring no other characters.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor lands himself in a pickle thanks to a conjuring trick that proves to be far from magic, while busybody Mrs Warboys becomes convinced her husband is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill in Professor Branestawm Returns
programme.desc: Harry Hill is back as the absent-minded professor with the multiple spectacles, who believes his money troubles are over when Lady Pagwell dies, leaving a substantial sum to fund local inventing. However, scheming local councillor Harold Haggerstone insists on holding a competition to decide who gets the money - and that's when a rival turns up - the self-proclaimed greatest inventor in the world Professor Algebrain. To make matters worse, Branestawm has been neglecting his young assistant Connie - and now she is working with his rival. Comedy drama, co-starring Steve Pemberton, David Mitchell, Vicki Pepperdine, Simon Day and Madeline Holliday.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Henry IX
programme.desc: New series. Comedy starring Charles Edwards as a king who has a crisis of confidence and tries to modernise the monarchy - despite the objections of his family. With Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes `Nervous Nerys' out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan insults Norfolk's farmers with insensitive on-air remarks about the BSE crisis, and it is not long before they exact a particularly appropriate revenge. Steve Coogan stars, with guest appearances by Simon Pegg and Chris Morris.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Bored with life at the Linton Travel Tavern, Alan goes looking for excitement in time-honoured fashion - by getting drunk and stealing a traffic cone. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, Phil Cornwell, Sally Phillips and David Schneider.(n)

programme.title: Jack
programme.desc: Prodigy. Beginning with Nicklaus' childhood upbringing, highlighted by the Golden Bear's relationship with his father (Charlie); meeting his wife (Barbara) in college at Ohio State; and his early successes as a professional golfer(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Angela Hartnett joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen for a discussion on food they consider a guilty pleasure. She creates a pizza bianco using rich and creamy Tallegio cheese, while resident drinks expert Kate Goodman picks three Italian reds that perfectly complement the dish. Plus, Rachel Khoo argues the case for full-fat food and Michel prepares an indulgent chocolate and salted caramel dessert.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The four heat winners enter the quarter-final, in which they face the daunting challenge of the Critic's Brief. Guest judge Jay Rayner gives them a simple instruction for a main dish - the twist being, the amateur cooks don't know who has set it until they come face to face with the food critic to hear his verdict. It's then back to the kitchen to prepare a dessert, again based on Rayner's brief - and this time, the one that doesn't make the grade fails to make it through to knockout week.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace put more keen cooks to the test in first of two heats this week. As usual they begin by serving up their Calling Card, a dish that showcases their talents. The judges' two favourites then sit it out while the others reinvent what they've just made, creating a new plate of food based on the main ingredient from the first round. After this cook-off, one of the amateurs is sent home, before the remaining four prepare dinner for a trio of former MasterChef champions, after which Friday's first two quarter-finalists will be decided.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes from Australia's Sunshine Coast and its hinterlands. To begin, he visits family run farms before making pho, a noodle soup.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: Peter showcases local seafood from the Sunshine Coast, including mooloolaba prawns and coral trout.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes for dishes that can be made well in advance, including a pollock ceviche, Provencal beef stew and a chocolate and croissant bread-and-butter pudding. Plus, Rachel's friends test a recipe while she takes to the sea with a local fisherman.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes for a fete, including chocolate, toffee and peanut squares, lemon cake, and brown scones with treacle and sesame seeds. She also visits an artisan chocolate-maker and gives members of the Irish Countrywoman's Association a sample of her scones.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Angela Harnett demonstrates from her home kitchen how to cook rib-eye steak with herby garlic butter, Italian-style chips, plus tomato and basil salad.(n)

programme.desc: Angela Harnett demonstrates from her home kitchen how to cook chorizo in red wine, aubergine and spiced chickpeas, plus garlic prawns with sherry.(n)

programme.desc: John Catucci samples Mexican rotisserie at Rostizado in Edmonton, and has `the cutest breakfast ever' at Ottawa's Wilf & Ada's.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal gives the classic British afternoon tea a unique twist, featuring his own take on the Victoria sandwich cake, an edible stand made out of sponge, and other imaginative treats. For tea, he brews a Darjeeling and hedgerow infusion and cucumber sandwich tea leaves, and there's also a casino inside a country house in Staffordshire, where the guests are able to eat the playing cards, casino chips and even the gambling table. Plus, one final surprise - a teapot that pours Earl Grey chocolate tea.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Dave Myers' Egypt.
programme.desc: The Hairy Biker fulfils a boyhood dream by visiting the pyramids at Giza, goes to the oasis of Al Fayoum in search of a dish with mythical properties and heads to a place on the banks of the Nile where ancient man first turned to farming. To mark the end of his journey, Dave is invited by a family of Nubians for a feast to celebrate the end of Eid Al Adha, and helps prepare a traditional meal that has become famous across the entire Arab world.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef takes a gastronomic road trip to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a melting pot of East and West. His journey begins in the city of Venice, and on the idyllic Greek island of Symi he cooks some of his favourite Venetian dishes including seafood risotto, tiramisu and gnocchi with spider crab.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal gives the classic British afternoon tea a unique twist, featuring his own take on the Victoria sandwich cake, an edible stand made out of sponge, and other imaginative treats. For tea, he brews a Darjeeling and hedgerow infusion and cucumber sandwich tea leaves, and there's also a casino inside a country house in Staffordshire, where the guests are able to eat the playing cards, casino chips and even the gambling table. Plus, one final surprise - a teapot that pours Earl Grey chocolate tea.(n)

programme.title: Naked Lunch

Meanwhile, the son of the Green Goblin seeks revenge over Spider-Man, whom he blames for his father's death(n)

programme.title: World Championship Boxing
programme.desc: Vasyl Lomachenko (7-1, 5 KOs) takes on Jason Sosa (20-1-4, 15 KOs) in a super-featherweight bout in Oxon Hill, Md. Also: Okeksandr Gvozdyk (12-0, 10 KOs) vs. Yunieski Gonzalez (18-2, 14 KOs) in a light-heavyweight matchup(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: The undefeated UConn Huskies (36-0) head to their 10th straight Final Four in pursuit of their fifth-consecutive national championship in Dallas. In a stunning upset, Mississippi State ends the Huskies' reign in a captivating overtime thriller(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Fate of the Furious'
programme.desc: A look at "The Fate of the Furious," a 2017 thriller that finds Dom being lured back into a life of crime by a mysterious woman who turns him against his own family. The film stars Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron and Dwayne Johnson, and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: Adaption of CS Lewis's fantasy novels about four British children who enter a magical world, where they befriend wondrous creatures and battle a witch(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Life Under Sharia & Plastic Oceans. programme.title: Making of 'Gifted'
programme.desc: A look at "Gifted," a 2017 drama about a man doing his best to raise his 7-year-old niece, whose emergence as a math prodigy leads to a custody battle between the man and his mother. The film stars Chris Evans, Mckenna Grace and Lindsay Duncan, and is directed Marc Webb(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: In this jarring apocalyptic pulse-pounder a scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night.(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.desc: A rescue mission is launched to investigate a mission to mars that ended in catastrophe and mysterious disaster(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Pilot. An adaptation of Tom Perrotta's novel about life in a small town after many of its residents vanished in a Rapture-like event begins with the upcoming third anniversary of the "Departure" and a police chief's personal and professional struggles(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Penguin One, Us Zero. Kevin sees a therapist after a series of unsettling encounters; Meg makes a crucial decision about her future; Tom and Christine find themselves in a dicey situation; Jill and Aimee take an interest in Carrie Coons' comings and goings(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Two Boats and a Helicopter. programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: B.J. and the A.C. Kevin has unexpected visitors at home, while work brings more surprises with a holiday display snafu and a detainee from another police station. Elsewhere, Tom and Christine encounter more trouble on the road and at a hospital(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Gladys. Laurie's resolve is put to the test in the wake of a brutal hate crime. Contains very strong language, extreme violence and distressing scenes(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Solace for Tired Feet. Kevin orders an APB after learning that his father has escaped from the psychiatric hospital; Jill tries to break a record for endurance; Tom makes a disturbing discovery while hunkering down in Indiana(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Cairo. While Kevin fears he's losing touch with reality, Jill begins a devastating downward spiral. Very strong language from the outset and distressing scenes(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: The Garveys at Their Best. Kevin obsesses over a marauding deer in the town and Laurie receives some news amid a rising sense of foreboding. Strong language(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: The Prodigal Son Returns. In the Season 1 finale, Mapleton descends into chaos after a Memorial Day mission by the Guilty Remnant. Meanwhile, Kevin gets an unexpected assist out of a jam in another town; Holy Wayne grants his final wish; Tom adjusts to a new life; and Nora mulls a difficult decision(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.sub-title: What Will We Do This Time About Adam?
programme.desc: What Will We Do This Time About Adam?. Shoshanna helps Ray slog through his new oral-history project until a fortuitous encounter with her old boss gives their venture a much-needed boost. Meanwhile, Adam has surprising news for Hannah; and Jessa spends a day off on her own(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course
programme.desc: Scrat's epic pursuit of the elusive acorn catapults him into the universe where he accidentally sets off a series of cosmic events that transform and threaten the Ice Age World(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: You Get What You Need. In the Season 1 finale, Celeste makes a bold move after another fight; Madeline deals with fallout from her past before the school's fall fund-raiser; and Jane learns who's really been hurting Amabella at school(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Jelani Cobb; Chelsea Handler; Ted Lieu; Evan McMullin; Ana Navarro
programme.desc: Jelani Cobb; Chelsea Handler; Ted Lieu; Evan McMullin; Ana Navarro. Columbia University journalism professor Jelani Cobb and comedian Chelsea Handler is an interview guest. The panelists are Rep. Ted Lieu (D-Cal.), former presidential candidate Evan McMullin and political analyst Ana Navarro(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: When Charlie Babbitt's father leaves his cash to the autistic brother Charlie never knew he had, the Babbitt boys embark on a road trip of discovery and card-counting(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: (1985) Ron Howard's heart-warming science-fiction comedy begins with mysterious strangers hiring Jack Bonner's (Steve Guttenberg) boat to raise giant 'sea anemones' off the sea floor near Florida. He discovers they are in fact from outer space, Antareans rescuing those left behind when Atlantis sank. They store the cocoons in a swimming pool next to an old folk's home but when three of the residents, Art Selwyn, Ben Luckett and Joe Finley (Oscar-winning Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley and Hume Cronyn), take a dip, the rejuvenating waters return their youth and vigour. As the home's other residents discover the secret, not only do love and jealousy once again rear their heads but the Antareans have to revise their rescue plans in the light of new events. HD Wide(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: This sparkling biopic of literary editor Max Perkins centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe. As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels, Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: The Four Horsemen return to clear their names with one last spectacular stunt and at the same time expose the unethical practices of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: An investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Somebody's Dead. In the premiere of an adaptation of Liane Moriarty's novel set in a seemingly idyllic seaside California town, a suspicious death at an elementary school fund-raiser exposes rivalries simmering beneath the superficial comity among some of the parents(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Serious Mothering. Madeline feels slighted by Renata and gets bad news about her community-theatre production; Ziggy asks Jane why they moved to Monterey; Celeste tells Perry they should seek counselling; Nathan and Ed have a tense meeting about their wives(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Living the Dream. Madeline organizes a trip to compete with Annabella's birthday party to annoy Renata. Meanwhile, Celeste's roller-coaster relationship with Perry continues before their first therapy session with Dr. Reisman; Abigail's guidance counselor wants to meet with Madeline; Principal Nippal announces the theme for the fall fund-raiser; and Jane asks for Madeline's help with Ziggy's family-tree project(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Push Comes to Shove. Nathan hosts a couples dinner for Madeline and Ed to discuss a "parenting paradigm" for Abigail. Meanwhile, Celeste prepares for a city-council meeting about Madeline's play, and clashes with Perry over the prospect of her returning to work; Jane meets with Ziggy's teacher to talk about classroom bullying; and Madeline stumbles upon a clue about Jane's past(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Once Bitten. Madeline gets encouraging news about the play from her director, but is unnerved by a significant change in his demeanour(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Burning Love. Madeline worries about Jane and the can of worms she opened. Meanwhile, Jane confronts Renata; Bonnie tells Nathan about Abigail's secret project; and Ed and Madeline have a candid conversation about the lack of passion in their marriage(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: You Get What You Need. In the Season 1 finale, Celeste makes a bold move after another fight; Madeline deals with fallout from her past before the school's fall fund-raiser; and Jane learns who's really been hurting Amabella at school(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Fate of the Furious'
programme.desc: A look at "The Fate of the Furious," a 2017 thriller that finds Dom being lured back into a life of crime by a mysterious woman who turns him against his own family. The film stars Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron and Dwayne Johnson, and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: Kaulder (Vin Diesel), a witch hunter, is cursed with immortality by the Witch Queen (Julie Englbrecht) right before she dies at his hand. As a result, he has been tracking down evil witches for centuries while leading a lonely existence separated from his wife and daughter. When the Witch Queen returns from the dead seeking retribution, a battle ensues and the fate of humanity hangs in the balance. Directed by Breck Eisner (The Crazies). Cast includes Elijah Wood, Rose Leslie, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson and Michael Caine(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: In a sun-parched, postapocalyptic future, loner Max gets caught up in the plight of a group of warrior women as they flee from an evil despot across a desert wasteland(n)
