programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: Kaulder (Vin Diesel), a witch hunter, is cursed with immortality by the Witch Queen (Julie Englbrecht) right before she dies at his hand. As a result, he has been tracking down evil witches for centuries while leading a lonely existence separated from his wife and daughter. When the Witch Queen returns from the dead seeking retribution, a battle ensues and the fate of humanity hangs in the balance. Directed by Breck Eisner (The Crazies). Cast includes Elijah Wood, Rose Leslie, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson and Michael Caine(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: After the little white lies of Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997), director David Mirkin focuses on scheming of a different sort in Heartbreakers. Sigourney Weaver and Jennifer Love Hewitt play Max and Page Conners, a mother and daughter who share everything with each other: relationship advice, hair and makeup hints, and the money they win in costly divorce settlements with rich men. When the film opens, the Conners are putting the finishing touches on conning Dean (Ray Liotta), an auto-body shop owner. When the dust from that scam clears, Page announces she's ready to move away from her mother and set up shop on her own -- but in order to clear an outstanding debt, Max insists they bankrupt one more bachelor together. They settle upon phlegmatic Palm Springs widower William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman), a chain smoker with a heart of gold and a similarly bountiful bank account. Only two things stand in their way: Tensy's Teutonic caretaker Miss Madress (Nora Dunn) and beachfront bartender Jack (Jason Lee), a wry stargazer with whom Page becomes unexpectedly smitten. Heartbreakers is the third collaboration from writers Steven Mazur and Paul Guy, whose previous screwball comedy was 1997's international hit, Liar Liar(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: When straight-laced cop Joe's partner quits the job, his new colleague couldn't be more of a mismatch. The unlikely pair must work together to solve a case of mysterious murders(n)

programme.title: The Haunted Mansion
programme.desc: A real-estate agent's family is stuck in a creepy old house crawling with ghosts(n)

programme.title: Ferrell Takes the Field
programme.desc: Will Ferrell plays baseball in five spring training games for 10 different teams on one day in March 2015 as a fund-raiser for cancer research, and to honor former major leaguer Bert Campaneris, who played every position in a game in 1965 for the Kansas City A's(n)

programme.title: Arthur 2: On the Rocks
programme.desc: The billionaire struggles to protect his marriage and money from his former fiancée's father(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: Off-kilter coming-of-age comedy about an overbearing matriarch who sees her son's new girlfriend as a threat to their not-so-perfect family life(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Squirrels. A squirrel's remarriage in a quarantined New York City finds one of her sons trying to impress a female guest, while the other plots to stop the wedding and squares off with his attention-hogging, soon-to-be little brother(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two bickering, elderly neighbours find that their rivalry heats up when an attractive woman moves in across the road. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: In this sequel to Friday, Ice Cube returns as the streetwise LA dude who grassed up a local gangster. Who's now out and on his trail. This would be a good time to chill out in the suburbs with cousin Mike Epps and uncle Don 'Dc' Curry, who happens to have won the lottery but, as he finds out, money can't buy you love or security in Steve Carr's smart comedy(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: Jackie Chan plays a Chinese man who travels to the Wild West to rescue a kidnapped princess. After teaming up with a train robber, the unlikely duo takes on a Chinese traitor and his corrupt boss(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: True crime story about teenage con man Frank Abagnale Jr - who cashed fake cheques worth over 2.5 million dollars while disguised as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer - and the FBI agent who finally caught him(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Kate Hudson and Matthew McConaughey ("How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days") reteam for a picturesque romantic adventure about a pair of divorced treasure hunters who are thrown together when one finds a clue to the whereabouts of a fortune in Spanish gold. Donald Sutherland, Ray Winstone, Alexis Dziena(n)

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Two enthusiastic young male wrestling fans watch their idol suffer what appears to be a humiliating defeat and decide to travel to Atlanta, the World Championship Wrestling headquarters, to cheer him up. They learn he is not at all the man they idolized; nonetheless, in a series of hilarious mishaps, they manage to revive his career(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: Farce in which a convicted petty thief who escapes from jail finds a filofax belonging to an uptight executive and decides to track down the owner and claim the promised $1,000 reward for its return, but he quickly finds himself mistaken for the owner. The crook is whisked off on the adman's hectic schedule, leaving the real high flyer stranded without money or contacts on the dangerous streets of Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: My Blue Heaven
programme.desc: F.B.I agent Barney Coopersmith is assigned to protect former Mafia figure turned informant Vincent Antonelli. But Antonelli has trouble trying to keep a low profile, which is required in the witness protection program. Coopersmith has his hands full trying to keep Antonelli away from the Mafia hitmen,not to mention the nightclubs(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Patrick Warburton and Julie Bowen star in John Pasquin's comedy-drama about a man whose life is changed by a bullying incident. Mild-mannered Joe Scheffer is taking his pre-teen daughter Natalie to a corporate event at his big pharma workplace when an argument over a parking space results in Joe being set upon by a colleague Mark McKinney. The incident destroys Joe's confidence and he sinks into a depression that keeps him away from work. But his life is set to change when the company's 'wellness co-ordinator', Meg Harper, pays him a visit. There's immediate mutual attraction, but something she says to Joe also inadvertently sparks a desire for revenge in him. It's not long before he's training with Chuck Scarett, a former martial arts film star; and - back at work - his new, assertive persona is winning him legions of friends. But not everyone is impressed - Natalie and Meg preferred him as he was..(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a Los Angeles hippie who, after being mistaken for a wealthy industrialist, becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a young woman for whom getting engaged is only the first step in a nightmare journey through the relationships minefield. Young advertising copywriter Gwyn Marcus (Sarah Jessica Parker) faces the biggest challenge of her life when she decides to accept the marriage proposal of her boyfriend Matt (Gil Bellows)(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Action comedy about an undercover policeman who befriends a petty criminal so that he can get evidence against a drugs baron. But with the target in sight, things start to go disastrously wrong(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Tale about a successful self-help guru and TV talk-show host who gets mixed up in a series of comic disasters when he goes home to Georgia for his parents' 50th wedding anniversary(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Roy (Nicolas Cage) is an agoraphobic obsessive-compulsive con man who sells water filters at ten times their value, by offering fabulous prizes to the buyers. When difficulties start interfering with their tricks, psychoanalysis appears as an alternative to pills. During the sessions, he begins to suspect he has a daughter (Alison Lohman), whose existence he never dared confirm. When he finally meets her, she is completely fascinated by her father's lifestyle, so much so, that she wants to go into partnership with him. At the casting for this film, Lohman dressed and behaved like a 14-year-old, until, under pressure from Ridley Scott, she admitted to being 22(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a Los Angeles hippie who, after being mistaken for a wealthy industrialist, becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: Brilliant comedy, with Marisa Tomei winning an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress, as two innocent New Yorkers are put on trial for murder in a small town and it is up to their brash Italian American cousin to save them(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Tale about a successful self-help guru and TV talk-show host who gets mixed up in a series of comic disasters when he goes home to Georgia for his parents' 50th wedding anniversary(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Comedy in which a former child star running a talent agency which is bereft of talented performers attempts to turn a young pickpocket into a star of TV commercials before she gets arrested - and before his business goes under(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Peanuts Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "The Peanuts Movie," a 2015 computer-animated comedy based on Charles M. Schulz's comic strip "Peanuts." The film is directed by Steve Martino(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: A socially awkward but very bright 15-year-old girl being raised by a single mom discovers that she is the princess of a small European country because of the recent death of her long-absent father, who, unknown to her, was the crown prince of Genovia. She must make a choice between continuing the life of a San Francisco teen or stepping up to the throne. While Mia makes up her mind, she's pressed into taking princess lessons from her grandmother(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Sleeping Beauty. A Latino version of "Sleeping Beauty" tells the tale of a princess who takes a 100-year siesta as the result of an evil fairy's curse. Voices: Ricardo Montalban (King Carlos), Lucie Arnaz (Queen Maria), Paul Rodriguez (Jesse), Julia Migenes (Evelina) and Jacob Vargas (Prince Luis)(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Rapunzel. Only HBO would have thought of staging the story of Rapunzel in New Orleans. The classic story is brought back to life with a Cajun/African-American twist. Also adding new zest to this animated gem are the voices of Whoopi Goldberg, Tisha Campbell, and Meshach Taylor. In this updated version, Rapunzel is captured by the evil diva Zenobia to become her apprentice diva. Never fear -- the story does end happily as Rapunzel is rescued by a brave prince. This updated fairly tale would have the Brothers Grimm wondering "why didn't we think of that?"(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Through a series of misunderstandings, Alvin, Simon and Theodore come to believe that Dave is going to propose to his new girlfriend in New York City and dump them. They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
programme.desc: Animated story of a wild Mustang stallion captured by horse traders and sold to a cavalry regiment at a frontier outpost, where a cruel colonel attempts to break the free-spirited horse. The stallion escapes in the company of a Native American youth, however, and embarks upon a series of adventures in the harsh and unforgiving times of the Old West(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage heads a stellar cast in David Bowers' animation, adapted from a manga comic-book character, about a robot boy (Freddie Highmore) who is simultaneously trying to save the world and find his place in it. Brilliant scientist Dr Tenma (Cage) is left devastated when his young son is killed during an experiment, and tries to recreate a robotic version of the boy, only to abandon him when he fails to meet expectations. Left to fend for himself, the robot becomes Astro Boy, possessed of a host of useful powers, not the least of which is the ability to fire bullets from his backside. When he becomes embroiled in a plot to exploit a new source of energy, Astro Boy must use all of his gifts to defeat the forces of evil. The array of vocal talent in attendance includes Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland, Bill Nighy, Nathan Lane, Charlize Theron, Kristen Bell and Little Britain's Matt Lucas(n)

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: A girl discovers an abandoned garden on her uncle's large Victorian country estate. With the help of a local boy, the girl sets out to restore the garden and, once it is blooming again, she discovers it has special powers(n)

programme.title: RocketMan
programme.desc: During NASA training, a member of the first manned mission to Mars is injured, so NASA chooses a replacement, computer geek Fred Randall. En route to Mars, Fred clashes with cocky crew captain William Overbeck, falls in love with beautiful officer Julie Ford, and cavorts with trained chimp Ulysses(n)

They have three days to get to him and stop the proposal, saving themselves not only from losing Dave but possibly from gaining a terrible stepbrother(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: An apartment block janitor discovers a magical woman in the swimming pool, who tells him that she has come from a children's fairytale and needs his help to return home. But something dangerous lurks in the woods as the story begins to take over the lives of the characters(n)

programme.desc: Newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan adopt an unruly Labrador puppy who - despite being the world's most disobedient dog - becomes a key part of their lives(n)

programme.desc: Scrat's epic pursuit of the elusive acorn catapults him into the universe where he accidentally sets off a series of cosmic events that transform and threaten the Ice Age World(n)

programme.desc: A boy dreams up shark-boy and lava-girl and the horror that lies within their planet(n)

programme.desc: Animation about a group of monsters released from hiding to save the world from invasion. When a meteorite from outer space hits Susan and turns her into a giant monster, the government capture and lock her away. Here, she meets a group of other genetically unusual inmates such as Dr Cockroach, The Missing Link and a blob called Bob. However, when planet Earth is invaded by megalomaniac alien squid Galaxxar, the monster squad are called on to save the world(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: After falling for the new girl in town, a bookish boy discovers that her family holds a powerful and magical secret. Fantasy romance with Alice Englert and Emma Thompson(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: A rescue mission is launched to investigate a mission to mars that ended in catastrophe and mysterious disaster(n)

programme.desc: A scheming politician programs bikini-clad robots to seduce his opponents so he can blackmail them(n)

programme.title: Ugly
programme.desc: A smart but lonely outsider looks for love in the wrong place. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: In six sprawling stories, history throws together the same souls, one generation after the next as humankind progresses - and regresses - from 19th century slave trading to a distant post-apocalyptic future(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: In this offbeat love story, a woman falls for an oddly principled hit man who kills anyone who hires him to commit murder. While she believes she's finally found the perfect guy, their romance is threatened by an FBI agent who's hunting her new beau(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Bruce Willis stars in this acclaimed Western set in the Prohibition era. John Smith (Willis) is a laid-back but much-feared gun-for-hire who cruises into the Texan bordertown of Jericho and finds himself in the heart of a bootlegging war between rival Irish and Italian gangs. With no loyalties other than to himself, Smith seizes the chance to play the two sides off against one another..(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Crashing on an unknown planet in the year 2029, astronaut Leo Davidson is caught up in a savage society where apes keep human slaves(n)

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: Spike Lee's drama about a jazz musician who forms a professional rivalry with an outspoken saxophonist, while at the same time encountering problems in his love life(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Taking a break from her long-term boyfriend Josh (Nicholas Braun), Alice (Dakota Johnson) sets out on a journey of self-discovery with her hard-drinking new friend Robin (Rebel Wilson). Meanwhile, Alice's career-driven older sister Meg (Leslie Mann) struggles with the idea of settling down, and uptight romantic Lucy (Alison Brie) searches for her perfect match. Adapted from former Sex and the City writer Liz Tuccillo's debut novel, this modern rom com was directed by Christian Ditter(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich returns to the helm for this long-awaited sequel to the 1996 blockbuster Independence Day. Fearful of another attack, the nations of Earth have teamed up against their common enemy -- the extraterrestrials who brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered alien technology to bolster their defenses, the alliance braces itself for another invasion. Jeff Goldblum and Bill Pullman reprise their roles from the original film, while Liam Hemsworth, Jessie Usher, and Maika Monroe are among the new additions to the cast(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Barb Wire
programme.desc: Futuristic fantasy about comic-book beauty and bounty hunter Barb Wire, whose town and business are under siege by warring factions(n)

programme.title: Powder
programme.desc: If you're a fan of The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles on Sky One then you'll want to see Sean Patrick Flanery's amazing performance in this acclaimed drama. He plays Powder, an albino boy whose mother died after giving birth to him and whose grandparents have recently died, leaving the 16-year-old boy alone in the basement where he has lived all his life. Emerging into an unaccepting and ignorant society, Powder soon finds his snow-white skin causing him big problems - but he is also blessed with a phenomenal IQ and some kind of ESP which win him friends in the reform school to which he is sent. Here he meets Jessie Caldwell (Mary Steenburgen), the school's head, and science teacher Donald Ripley (Jeff Goldblum), who between them decide to help Powder come to terms with life in the cruel real world(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama about five school kids - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - who are brought together on a day-long detention. Despite their original hostilities, and a psychotic teacher, the motley crew break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school(n)

programme.title: Wildcats
programme.desc: Inspiration 80s style as teacher Molly McGrath's incessant requests to coach finally force the authorities to give her a chance. Molly becomes the only woman in the mens' locker room, but her new squad of rebels are the worst team in the league..(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Accused of cheating and desperate to prove his innocence, an eighteen-year-old orphan from the slums of Mumbai reflects back on his tumultuous life while competing to win 20 million rupees on India's Who Wants to Be a Millionaire in Danny Boyle's inspirational drama. Jamal Malik (Dev Patel) may not have a penny to his name, but that could all change in a matter of hours. He's one question away from taking the top prize on India's most popular television game show, but as with everything else in Jamal's life, it isn't going to be easy. Arrested by police under suspicion of cheating, Jamal is interrogated by the authorities. The police simply can't believe that a common "slumdog" could possibly possess the knowledge to get this far in the game, and in order to convince them of how he gained such knowledge, Jamal begins reflecting back on his childhood. As young boys, Jamal and his older brother, Salim, lived in squalor, and lost their mother in a mob attack on Muslims. Subsequently forced to rely on their own wits to survive, the desperate siblings fell back on petty crime, eventually befriending adorable yet feisty young Latika as they sought out food and shelter on the unforgiving streets of Mumbai. Though life on the streets was never easy, Jamal's experiences ultimately instilled in him the knowledge he needed to answer the tough questions posed to him on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire. And though Jamal makes a convincing case for himself, one question still remains: why would a young man with no apparent desire for wealth or fame be so determined to win big on a national game show? Of course, it won't be long until everyone finds out the answer to this burning question, because as Jamal sits down to find out whether he will be rich beyond his wildest dreams, 60 million viewers remain transfixed to their televisions eager to see if he'll correctly answer the final question(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: After her mother commits suicide, nineteen year old Lucy Harmon travels to Italy to have her picture painted. However, she has other reasons for wanting to go. She wants to renew her acquaintance with Nicolo Donati, a young boy with whom she fell in love on her last visit four years ago. She also is trying to solve the riddle left in a diary written by her dead mother, Sara(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: Four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.desc: Harry Dean Stanton stars as a repossession man who inhabits the murky underworld of Los Angeles with Emilo Estevez as his apprentice. Alex Cox directs(n)

programme.desc: In a feature-length SG-1 special, Ba'al travels back in time and erases the Stargate programme from history. Can the team put the timeline back on track?(n)

programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter-turned-singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same events(n)

programme.title: Kicks

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Five Oscars went to this enthralling biography of 20th-century icon Howard Hughes. The epic drama details Hughes' glory years from the 1920s to the '40s, when he earned a vast fortune making films and designing planes, while also romancing Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Accused of cheating and desperate to prove his innocence, an eighteen-year-old orphan from the slums of Mumbai reflects back on his tumultuous life while competing to win 20 million rupees on India's Who Wants to Be a Millionaire in Danny Boyle's inspirational drama. Jamal Malik (Dev Patel) may not have a penny to his name, but that could all change in a matter of hours. He's one question away from taking the top prize on India's most popular television game show, but as with everything else in Jamal's life, it isn't going to be easy. Arrested by police under suspicion of cheating, Jamal is interrogated by the authorities. The police simply can't believe that a common "slumdog" could possibly possess the knowledge to get this far in the game, and in order to convince them of how he gained such knowledge, Jamal begins reflecting back on his childhood. As young boys, Jamal and his older brother, Salim, lived in squalor, and lost their mother in a mob attack on Muslims. Subsequently forced to rely on their own wits to survive, the desperate siblings fell back on petty crime, eventually befriending adorable yet feisty young Latika as they sought out food and shelter on the unforgiving streets of Mumbai. Though life on the streets was never easy, Jamal's experiences ultimately instilled in him the knowledge he needed to answer the tough questions posed to him on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire. And though Jamal makes a convincing case for himself, one question still remains: why would a young man with no apparent desire for wealth or fame be so determined to win big on a national game show? Of course, it won't be long until everyone finds out the answer to this burning question, because as Jamal sits down to find out whether he will be rich beyond his wildest dreams, 60 million viewers remain transfixed to their televisions eager to see if he'll correctly answer the final question(n)

programme.title: God vs. Satan
programme.desc: This spiritually-themed documentary rests on a central, simple discovery: though the Christian take on the "end of the world" (as described in the Revelation of St. John) has received exhaustive treatment in various films and books, the actual concept of Armageddon - a final battle between God and Satan - is rarely discussed. This program constitutes an unusual exception; it actually dissects clues given in scripture in an attempt to determine truths about what will happen just before the final curtain comes down on the world. It suggests that the said battle will transpire at Meggido, a battlefield that still exists in present-day Israel. The program asks where the stories of Armageddon come from, how they have evolved over the years and how they vary among the three major religions that claim Abraham as a central figure(n)

programme.desc: In East Sussex, the expert walker sets off from the village of East Dean, as she explores one of the longest undeveloped coastlines on the south coast - one that is disappearing at an erosion rate of almost one meter a year. During her three-hour walk Julia discovers the area's rich social history at seaside settlement Birling Gap, learns of the mystery of Sherlock Holmes' retirement, and hears how a lighthouse had to be shifted 17 metres back from the cliff edge.(n)

programme.desc: A body is found buried on the Northumberland moors which could be a missing teenager from the nearby rural community of Brindale. The girl had disappeared six weeks previously, and Vera has to break the news to her devastated family. However, the realisation that she died so close to home rather than at a music festival as originally thought creates tension among her neighbours, who are soon suspecting each other of murder. The detective delves into the vulnerable young woman's isolated existence to identify her killer. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: A production of the hit Broadway musical, originally recorded live for US television. In 1962 Baltimore, plump teenager Tracy Turnblad's dream is to dance on the Corny Collins Show, a TV programme popular with local teens. Against all odds, she wins a role on the show and becomes a celebrity overnight, meeting a colourful array of characters along the way. Tracy's mother - the indomitable and stuck-in-the-past Edna - has her eyes opened by her daughter and her new friends, and encourages Tracy in her campaign to integrate the all-white Corny Collins Show. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois's allergy forces Brian to move into Stewie's bedroom, but the two have a difficult time as roommates, while Peter branches out and takes up DJing.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Lois Comes Out of Her Shell.
programme.desc: Lois is not looking forward to her birthday, so she decides to turn her life around by adopting a different, younger lifestyle, growing her hair and having a makeover on a shopping trip. Meanwhile, Stewie finds a turtle at the park and adopts him as a new pet.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Exhausted by a European book tour, Jessica stops off to see an old friend who owns a luxurious Monte Carlo hotel, but it is not long before a murderer checks in. Ian Ogilvy guest stars, with Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Sparkling Cyanide
programme.desc: Modern reworking of Agatha Christie's classic murder mystery, starring Pauline Collins, Oliver Ford Davies, Kenneth Cranham and Susan Hampshire. A football chairman hosts a glitzy party to celebrate a new signing, but as the guests raise their glasses to toast a successful future, his wife suddenly drops dead. A pair of MI5 agents are called in to investigate, and it's not long before the finger of suspicion points at the victim's husband - until he too is murdered.(n)

programme.title: The Railway Children
programme.desc: Three Edwardian children are forced to leave their comfortable middle-class London home and move to the wilds of Yorkshire after their father is wrongfully imprisoned for treason. Family drama adapted from E Nesbit's story, starring Jenny Agutter, Sally Thomsett, Gary Warren, Dinah Sheridan, Bernard Cribbins, William Mervyn and Iain Cuthbertson.(n)

programme.title: Heidi
programme.desc: Concluding part of the adaptation of Johanna Spyri's children's novel about an orphan sent to stay with her reclusive grandfather in the Swiss mountains. Noley Thornton and Jason Robards star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: By the Pricking of My Thumbs.
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Shaun Evans steps into the shoes of John Thaw in this 1965-set prequel to Inspector Morse, playing a younger version of the cerebral detective involved in the hunt for a missing schoolgirl. Soon deep in a full-blown murder investigation, Endeavour is sidelined, discredited and at a dead end - so he risks all to begin his own quest for justice. Roger Allam and Charlie Creed-Miles co-star in the mystery.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady).(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An idyllic summer day in Oxford is torn asunder when a parcel bomb claims the life of eminent mathematician Adam Capstone, a genius in the field of `Knot Theory'. As Lewis and Hathaway investigate, they discover that, while the victim's academic reputation was beyond reproach, his private life was far more dubious. It emerges Capstone was a man of carnal appetites, who had a string of affairs with young students, betraying his chemistry professor wife Elizabeth, providing her with a clear motive to do away with her cheating spouse. As the detectives work to identify the killer bomber, the case becomes a personal challenge for Lewis, who fears he may not be rewarded with another contract should he fail to impress Moody before his six-month trip to New Zealand. Detective drama, starring Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox, with Zoe Tapper, Tristam Summers and Oliver Lansley.(n)

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Family and friends reminisce about one of British TV's greatest comedians, including Les's widow Tracy and dance troupe the Roly Polys, who recall working with him.(n)

programme.title: Colditz
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama. Believing Jack to be dead, Lizzie turns to drink in an effort to keep her nerves under control - but her problems multiply rapidly as her flat receives a direct hit from a German bomber. The prisoners' morale receives a boost as they are sent parcels of unusual gifts - which conceal vital escape equipment. Sawyer finally returns to Blighty and quickly develops suspicions about McGrade, while Ullmann learns about Rhett's dependence on morphine. Tom Hardy, Sophia Myles, Guy Henry, Damian Lewis and Jason Priestley star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Abandoned by his wife and faced with financial ruin, local farmer Richard Harvey finally reaches the end of his tether, and heads into Aidensfield to air his grievances in a particularly memorable way. Meanwhile, the arrival of a handsome stranger sets Gina's heart racing - but he could be a dangerous criminal. Vernon and David branch out into a new line of business, and soon manage to pep up a few palates with Aunt Beth's tangy horseradish sauce.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits London, where she is introduced to an MP, a meeting that proves to be the kiss of death for the unfortunate fellow. However, the mystery surrounding his murder deepens as the corpse goes missing only to reappear with a new identity. Whodunit, guest starring Trevor Eve and Sharon Maughan.(n)

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Holmes is plagued by a recurring dream that may have its roots in the case of Lord Robert St Simon, whose bride disappeared on their wedding day. Guest starring Simon Williams, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geoffrey Beevers, with Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates her friend Elspeth McGillicuddy's claim to have witnessed a murder being committed on a passing train during a rail journey, but everyone is stumped by the lack of a body. Mystery, starring Geraldine McEwan, Pam Ferris, Niamh Cusack, John Hannah, Amanda Holden, Griff Rhys Jones, David Warner, Jenny Agutter and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Their investigation begins with factory owners the Plummers, who seem to be hiding more than their share of secrets. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian's time at Battersea Dogs & Cats Home is coming to an end and he's finding it difficult to say goodbye to his furry friends. Little does he know that the staff are planning a surprise for him on his last day. Paul also teaches sign language to a deaf dog, and a chihuahua-cross that underwent a Caesarean section earlier in the series is reunited with two of its surviving puppies, which have been hand-reared since birth.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs & Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. In his first week, Paul helps with the arrival of a litter of puppies, meets a neglected, dangerously underweight Staffordshire bull terrier that was found in a park, and assists in the interview of DJ and presenter Neil Fox and his family, who are hoping to adopt a young Jack Russell.(n)

programme.title: Tonight at the Palladium
programme.desc: Return of the variety show from the West End theatre, featuring a different host each week. Bradley Walsh introduces music by Olly Murs, and Madness perform some of their greatest hits and a surprise collaboration. Tenor Alfie Boe takes on a song from the Who's classic rock opera Quadrophenia and there's a 10th anniversary performance by the cast of Billy Elliot the Musical. Plus, slapstick comedy duo Men in Coats, stand-up star Jo Brand and acrobatic animal act Olate Dogs, winners of America's Got Talent 2012.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

Double bill of the drama, starring Albert Finney, Joe Prospero and Sue Johnston.(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: The actress is left distraught over Edward VII's death and dies alone soon afterwards. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman with Alzheimer's disease inadvertently commits a series of crimes, while Gina becomes suspicious of two customers staying at the pub.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick tries to keep the peace during a feud between neighbours, and Greengrass thinks his luck has changed for the better when he wins first prize in a raffle.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The town of Aidensfield falls victim to a spate of burglaries - which all seem to be aimed at Maggie.(n)

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Things are looking rosy for Carol and Proctor, who have recently become engaged, but Duggan is not so easily swayed from his devious plans and begins to work his charm on Carol, as well as working on a deal that could spell the end of Albery Glass forever. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A stripper meets a nasty fate when she confides that she has overheard a conversation about the murder of a wealthy countess. Michael Gambon stars in this instalment of the detective drama, featuring an early screen appearance by Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An archaeologist's wife is murdered during an excavation in the Middle East. Fortunately, a vacationing Poirot - who shares with most great detectives an inability to go on holiday without stumbling over a body or two - is on hand to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Ron Berglas, Georgina Sowerby and Iain Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Leslie falls in with a bad crowd and ends up being falsely accused of armed robbery, prompting Louisa to take desperate measures to save him. Margo takes a shine to a gardener at the Villa Mavrodaki, Captain Creech returns, and the family realises the extent of Gerry's passion for animals when he turns his bedroom into a centre for scientific learning. Guest starring Leslie Caron.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The pipe-smoking sleuth is forced to take drastic measures to trap a serial killer terrorising the women of Montmartre, employing a policewoman as a decoy. Drama starring Michael Gambon, with Ciaran Madden and Geoffrey Hutchings.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: To Burn in Every Drop of Blood - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the victim of a frenzied attack is found in the woods, the team initially wonders whether it is random or related to the location - a shrine to a local girl who recently committed suicide there. However, Banks has a theory of his own. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: To Burn in Every Drop of Blood - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. When a woman commits suicide, her grieving father relies on violence to procure answers as he investigates his daughter's death. She left a note confessing to Damon Horsley's murder, but Banks is suspicious, and his hunch is confirmed when it appears that the woman's death is not a simple suicide and someone else may have been involved. The pressure is on as the team gathers evidence and tries to solve two murders. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As Syndicate 9 investigates the discovery of a woman's body in a Manchester hotel room, Gill introduces Rachel to high-flying DS Will Pemberton, unaware they are already well acquainted - they've been having a passionate, secret relationship for months. But while the volatile copper can be discreet when it comes to romance, will she be able to hide her feelings when Gill lets slip that she wasn't the first choice for the sergeant's job? Meanwhile, Janet is keen to give her own love life a boost, especially after seeing how happy Ade is with his new partner Eleanor. However, a speed-dating event might not be the best option, as Janet finds herself treating each brief encounter like a police interrogation. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Amelia Bullmore, Steve Touissant and Mina Anwar.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Unable to get used to the fact she was second choice for the sergeant's job, Rachel punishes Janet for keeping the truth from her, and although Will cheers her up with the news she has been chosen for a vice initiative, the detective is soon stung by Gill's harsh words. Meanwhile, an unconscious baby is admitted to hospital with injuries that do not match his parents' explanation of events, and when an unregistered childminder and her boyfriend enter the equation, it's unclear who had the boy's best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: As Lord Melbourne's popularity in the house wanes, the Tories eagerly await their imminent triumph, while the Duke of Cumberland views it as a chance to prey on his niece's vulnerability and establish a co-regency with the Duchess of Kent and Conroy. Victoria is devastated when Melbourne regretfully announces he is stepping down and even more bewildered that she must ask complete stranger Sir Robert Peel to form a government, and she desperately implores Melbourne to return. Period drama, starring Jenna Colman and Rufus Sewell.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw investigate a theft from an elderly care-home resident after Sue Wilkins reports that £60 has gone missing from her father's chest of drawers. Although the man's carer becomes a suspect, Sue quickly finds the finger pointed at her by another member of staff. Drama filmed in the format of a documentary, with Jane Antrobus and Ben Hull, and guest stars Wendi Peters and Peter Baldwin (Coronation Street). Narrated by Tom Butcher.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mushgon Dadfar hosts the first dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, and has high hopes for her Caribbean-themed evening. However, the guests have little time to let their meal settle before they face an energetic Zumba session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. As a fortysomething woman who lunches and is used to entertaining, she has high hopes that all those years of practice will make her glamorous evening a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton examines properties on the Solway coast of Dumfries and Galloway, including a modern home that sits on top of a 100 foot cliff in In Sandyhills Bay. He also heads for the picturesque port of Kirkcudbright, where he explores a home that takes its inspiration partly from local lighthouses and a Russian architectural masterpiece. Plus, a restored 15th century tower house at Barholm, near Gatehouse of Fleet, and a shoreline Cotswolds-style house at Arbigland.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp goes property hunting in the trendy suburb of Heaton in Newcastle, to help Tom and Liz find a new home as they are tired of renting flats. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer is in the Tyne Valley searching for a family home for couple Michael and Sorrel, who only have two months left in their current rental property.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond give advice to a couple who are buying their first home together in Cornwall, but he wants to live by the beach while she loves the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesn't work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the `porn film' discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests' competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Layla's manners are criticised.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his host's organic 'niche'. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him 'weird, naked Tim'. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tim's order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one last time to find out what they have been paid. Geri kicks off proceedings by demanding to know why Sarah and Luke did not want a return visit to Greenways of Malvern, before they in turn confront Sanjeev and Elinor over their low cleanliness score for Ferry Lodge. Then the Court Colman Manor proprietors accuse Sarah and Luke of unfairly judging their hotel, before the payments are revealed and the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher Kirsty Davenport kicks off a week of dinner parties in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where she hopes that a simple menu will impress her guests - property finder Ann-Marie Hamilton, sales consultant Russell Turnbull, part-time lecturer Adam Holt and hairdresser Becci Moloney.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ann-Marie Hamilton hosts day two in Eastbourne, where she plans to entertain her guests by singing in her garden. Fellow contestant Russell makes a lot of jokes, but foodie Adam does not seem amused.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Becci Moloney hosts the third dinner party in Eastbourne, East Sussex, and prepares a menu of hearty food for her guests. Her outdoor bar makes a positive impression on rivals Kirsty and Ann-Marie, but Russell and Adam are puzzled by her collection of recycled toilets in the garden.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Adam Holt hosts the fourth dinner party in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where his fellow competitors' expectations are high. However, some of them are surprised by his menu - which fails to amount to much more than sausages and mashed potato.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Raconteur Russell Turnbull hosts the final night in Eastbourne, East Sussex. Having played his cards close to his chest all week with regards to his culinary skills, his plans for a fancy menu intrigue his rivals. However, for all the bravado, it remains to be seen whether he can actually cook.(n)

programme.title: Hunt for the Arctic Ghost Ship
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multi-million-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: An exploration of the most unusual airports on the planet, including a runway squeezed between skyscrapers, a landing strip carved into mountains and an airport where the runway disappears with every tide. Plus, a military base that has been under repeated attacks for 10 years.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Roisin Conaty compete against Jon Richardson and Nish Kumar. Adam Buxton joins the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Jack is hauled off to the local old priests' home to be treated for a strange medical complaint. He is replaced by a younger man - who proceeds to drive everyone crazy by playing jungle music at ear-splitting volume for hours on end. Dermot Morgan and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The Craggy Island clerics face the prospect of an untimely death during the return flight from a visit to a holy shrine. Jack quickly commandeers the only parachute and bails out, taking the drinks trolley with him - leaving Ted and Dougal to their fate.(n)

programme.title: Hunt for the Arctic Ghost Ship
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multi-million-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedians Joe Wilkinson and Chris Ramsey, Countdown's Rachel Riley and actress Tina Malone (Shameless) join captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock for the irreverent panel show in which two teams answer questions based on opinion polls. Jimmy Carr is the host.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott tries to help a Spanish rescue cat with a chronic eye condition, and a heartbroken young owner finds out the shocking news about her puppy.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Bill Bailey takes his dog out in the Lake District, Sarah Parish is in the New Forest with her border terrier and Ben Fogle is in Dungeness with his Labrador.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Med
programme.desc: Near Positano, on Italy's Amalfi coast, Charlie Luxton visits a fifties hillside villa that is a vision of modernity, and also examines a restored 17th-century house near Praiano.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Liza Macias hosts the first party in Warwickshire and hopes wooing her diners with a French menu and three hunky waiters will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sailor Steve Aston hosts the second dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping his nautical-themed evening will impress the women in the group and win him the £1,000 prize. But what will the ladies think when they discover the secrets of his `love ship'?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin manager Emma Reddin hosts the third dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes to secure the £1,000 prize by offering her guests pea and potato samosas and a selection of Indian curries, and organising Bollywood dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PA Pinky Sidhu hosts the fourth dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping to educate her guests about the finer things in life with an evening of sophistication and pageantry. However, the diners quickly find fault with her starter and dessert, and there is a surprise winner of the beauty competition she arranged as entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Alison Firth hosts the final dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes that her 1980s disco-themed night featuring a marshmallow competition will impress her guests enough to see her win the cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one another's stay was worth. Amber is offended by Derek's low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheila's feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eco campaigner Hector Christie holds the first dinner party in Devon, hoping his selection of raw food and home-grown produce will win him the £1,000 cash prize. His guests - make-up artist Kirsten Brend, slate salesman Damion Fearnley, theatre nurse Jenny Fox and retired housekeeper Viv Foster - are more interested in the stately home he lives in, so the host reveals an unusual surprise to command their attention.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Kirsten Brend showcases her Danish roots while hosting the second dinner party in Devon, serving a traditional menu to celebrate her heritage and some Eurovision-style entertainment to demonstrate her singing skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Slate salesman Damion Fearnley hosts the third dinner party in Devon, hoping to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food. No dish is as simple as it sounds, and Damion has given each one his own little twist. Unfortunately for him, two of the diners seem more intent on taking verbal swipes at each other than bites out of his food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre nurse Jenny Fox's dinner party in Devon fails to get off to the best start when Damion Fearnley is not impressed by the dishes on offer and Hector Christie takes exception to her choice of main course. Meanwhile, the tension between Viv Foster and Kirsten Brend continues as they show no sign of putting their disagreement behind them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired housekeeper Viv Foster hosts the final night in Devon, and feels in confident mood after years of experience serving the rich and famous. She pulls out all the stops to impress with a butler, silver service and her favourite tried and tested recipes. With tension mounting between Viv and Kirsten for some time though, her plans to put on the perfect evening may yet be sabotaged.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie help Daria and Emma slim down for a birthday bash in seven days, and cafe cook Stacie Stewart helps dieters turn their diets into delicious dishes. Plus, bridesmaids Emma and Elisa go on six week dieting plans for a forthcoming wedding, and entrepreneurs Dom and Adam want to slim down for a corporate summer party in four months. To find out how fasting affects body and mind, Xand also goes on an extreme water-only fast, and investigates if so called zero calorie and negative calorie foods really exist.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Jack is hauled off to the local old priests' home to be treated for a strange medical complaint. He is replaced by a younger man - who proceeds to drive everyone crazy by playing jungle music at ear-splitting volume for hours on end. Dermot Morgan and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The Craggy Island clerics face the prospect of an untimely death during the return flight from a visit to a holy shrine. Jack quickly commandeers the only parachute and bails out, taking the drinks trolley with him - leaving Ted and Dougal to their fate.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: Dan is sent on a diversity course after his complete lack of political correctness alarms headmistress Miss Lipsey, and decides to make an injured Brian part of his idiotic plans. At the beauty salon, Jo hits on the idea of combining two celebrity looks into one genuinely incredible makeover. Comedy, starring Greg Davies and Roisin Conaty.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: After a very unwelcome appraisal of his teaching skills, fate conspires to throw Dan directly into the path of his childhood enemy. Meanwhile, Jo has a new money-making scheme, and Brian is determined to be published in the local paper. Comedy, starring Greg Davies.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A five-year-old is rushed into St George's struggling to breathe, and her mum reveals how she has spent months in Great Ormond Street Hospital after being diagnosed with a rare form of juvenile arthritis. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old man in a confused state arrives in A&E after falling over, and as doctors carry out tests and a CT scan, his wife helps them understand the reason behind his confusion. Plus, a twelve-year-old girl must be brave as she undergoes treatment for a nasty cut on her leg.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. However, as he looks further back, his family tree springs some unexpected surprises.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown

Francis and John Brennan come to the aid of the old-fashioned owner of a struggling guesthouse, and try to persuade her that she needs to pay attention to internet reviews, which can have a far more significant effect on a business than she is aware. She also has to make plans for how the house will be run after her son leaves to work overseas.(n)

Plus, how new Irish research in barley production might soon change global agriculture.(n)

Meanwhile, Dylan finally acknowledges he needs help as he continues to struggle with his obsessive-compulsive disorder, and Duffy manages to inspire Louise into considering a return to nursing. programme.desc: An edition of the historical comedy focusing on the 11th-century Norman monarch, including his quarrels with Harold Godwinson about who should be king of England and the Battle of Hastings in 1066. Plus, a look at how Chinese technology was far ahead of the Normans and Saxons in England, and the programme meets one of the world's first scientists in Egypt. Guest starring Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.desc: Eight puppies and their underweight mum are found confined in a small space, and Graeme Petty is determined to get justice for little Haribo, a terrified Staffordshire bull terrier rescued from a house in Liverpool. Meanwhile, Herchy Boal tries to discover why Blade has chronic fur loss, and cameras follow Roo, a dog born with three legs who is determined to never give up.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: A wandering swordsman is knighted for his fighting prowess at the court of King Arthur and his wife, Lady Guinevere. However, the new knight and the queen develop a dangerous and secret attraction for each other, while a neighbouring warlord threatens the downfall of the kingdom. Adventure, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery, Julia Ormond and Ben Cross.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: From the windswept highland valleys of Bhutan to the glacial peaks of Karakoram, this programme investigates the climatic variations of the Himalayan region that is home to some of the most distinctive creatures on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: New series. Wildlife series following animals that are able to defy gravity in various ways. The first programme features caracal cats, which jump to catch birds out of the air, and reveals how kangaroos' hopping movements help them find water in the desert. Leaping snakes are able to glide without wings in the jungles of Borneo while insects are able to accelerate up to 700G.(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: Homeland

programme.title: Agora
programme.desc: An astronomer in Roman-occupied 4th-century Egypt develops controversial scientific theories - including the notion that the Earth is a sphere. Her research is threatened as conflict between pagans and Christians explodes into violence, while her slave is torn between his unrequited love for her and his new-found loyalty to Christianity. Historical drama, with Rachel Weisz and Max Minghella.(n)

programme.desc: Valerie is less than thrilled when her estranged husband approaches the company to help his sister, who has suffered horrible side effects in a multiple sclerosis clinical trial.(n)

programme.desc: An impromptu Ofsted inspection spreads panic throughout the staff at Greybridge, as the teachers worry about what a negative report could mean for their careers. With cheating at sports, ludicrously tight outfits and rampant bribery all considered fair game, it seems there's nothing they won't resort to when it comes to holding on to their jobs. For Ms Baron however, the main concern is whether the inspectors' presence will mean she isn't able to enjoy a bag of marijuana she has confiscated from a pupil. Guest star Sylvestra Le Touzel (Utopia) joins David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister in the classroom comedy.(n)

Secret cameras also spy on customers at a pub carvery, and David Lewis joins the touchline at Bath Rugby Club to test the theory that fans on the losing side eat more than those supporting the winning team.(n)

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Colin Stafford-Johnson explores the biodiversity of Tipperary woods, where he finds woodlice, centipedes, earthworms, slugs, beetles and spiders all battling to survive on the forest floor. The cameraman uses a special macro lens to capture unique footage of wood ants - but manages to get bitten in the process. He also receives guidance from Professor John Green of the University of Limerick. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Coast Australia
programme.desc: Neil Oliver and the team explore Queensland, where Miriam Corowa investigates the engineering behind the 1970s Florida-style canal system of the Gold Coast. Brendan Moar dives headlong into a dangerous current to investigate first-hand the science of rip tides, while Xanthe Mallett visits a Second World War fortification at what could have been Australia's frontline and discovers what life was like waiting for the war to arrive. Emma Johnston joins a scientific hunt for sea cows, and Tim Flannery travels to Fraser Island to investigate what's at the end of the line for the longest sand drift system in the world.(n)

programme.title: John Bishop's Gorilla Adventure
programme.desc: The stand-up comic leaves the relative comfort of the stage behind to observe mountain gorillas in their native habitat in the forests of Rwanda. He discovers they and his own family have more in common than he imagined possible - adolescent males are just like his teenage sons, with bulging muscles but little sense. John spends time with the Gorilla Doctors, a group of vets dedicated to protecting the 880 animals still in the wild by treating them at the first sign of illness or injury. He learns that the vets once had to amputate the bottom part of a three-day-old's leg and he not only survived, but is also on track to become a full-grown Silverback.(n)

The pair head to America for a radical two-week course of sex therapy designed to help them face their fears.(n)

programme.title: My Tattoo Addiction

Plus, Helen and Amy, whose tattoos are part of their attempt to fit into a world they believe views them as outsiders.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Catherine and Simon went through years of fertility treatment to have their first son, which took a toll on their love life, but five years later, awaiting an elective C-section for their second baby, it's a different story - a spontaneous romantic evening resulted in an unexpected positive pregnancy test. Heather ran into complications during her first pregnancy and had to deliver twins at 24 weeks. They pulled through, but cerebral palsy and other issues have meant she is now a full-time carer to them both. She also has Alfie, and after he was born, she and partner Dan decided they would have a fourth child to give him a companion to help share the responsibility of siblings with a disability. Christian couple Naomi and Dan tied the knot young and had their first child 13 months ago. Now, they're back at Southmead for baby number two.(n)
