programme.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bumbling Inspector Clouseau's adventures seem to have come to an end when he is mistakenly declared dead. However, the disaster-prone detective is in fact alive and well, and takes advantage of the situation to launch an undercover investigation into his own murder, adopting a variety of cunning disguises. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Burt Kwouk and Dyan Cannon.(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell.(n)

programme.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut
programme.desc: The crusading grown-ups of the Colorado town lead America into war against Canada in a bid to eradicate bad language from TV. The four young heroes set out to bring peace to the world, but have to battle a fearsome alliance between Satan and Saddam Hussein. Animated musical comedy, with the voices of Trey Parker and Matt Stone, as well as George Clooney, Eric Idle and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: A journalist leaves behind her sheltered life in New York to report from the front line in Afghanistan. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tina Fey and Margot Robbie.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Bruno
programme.desc: A gay Austrian fashion journalist becomes a figure of hate in his own country, and heads to America in search of celebrity with his adoring assistant in tow. He embarks on a campaign of publicity stunts to make himself famous, encountering prejudice and meeting people similarly desperate for stardom. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen and Gustaf Hammarsten.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: A bus driver's forthcoming wedding is jeopardised by his fiancee's hostile parents and a raunchy stag night organised by well-meaning friends. Comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Adrian Zmed, William Tepper and Tawny Kitaen.(n)

programme.title: Road Trip
programme.desc: Four students hit the road, heading off on a foolhardy mission to retrieve an embarrassing video mistakenly sent to an unsuspecting girlfriend - but it is not long before things go wrong and they end up having several nasty scrapes. Comedy, starring Tom Green as the tale's narrator, with Breckin Meyer, Seann William Scott, Amy Smart, Paulo Costanzo and DJ Qualls.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: Teenager Marty McFly travels back to the 1950s in a time machine built by his eccentric inventor friend. The return journey proves tricky enough, but he also accidentally alters the sequence of events that led to his parents falling in love - and has to persuade his future dad to win his mother's heart, or he will never be born. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson and Crispin Glover.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly travels to the 21st century, where he has to save his children from a terrible fate. However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly is transported back to the days of the Wild West, where he strives to save his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown from death at the hands of a villainous gunslinger. Final instalment in the sci-fi comedy trilogy, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen and Thomas F Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: Three kids fall foul of the local bully on their first day at high school, so they advertise for a bodyguard. They end up hiring a man who turns out to be a low-rent mercenary, but discover their new-found protector is not quite the hardened soldier of fortune he claims to be. Comedy, starring Owen Wilson, Leslie Mann, Nate Hartley and Troy Gentile.(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: A male stripper who retired from the stage three years ago is persuaded to put on one last show. A troupe of dancers are also planning to call it a day and recruit him to headline their final show. The guys head off on a road trip to the venue, making some new friends and picking up a few new moves along the way. Drama sequel, starring Channing Tatum and Joe Manganiello.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: A stressed businessman just wants to make it home to spend Thanksgiving with his family. However, when his flight is forced to land miles from its destination, he finds himself sharing a disaster-strewn journey across America with an amiable but slobbish salesman. Comedy road movie, starring Steve Martin, John Candy, Laila Robins, Kevin Bacon and Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: Office Space
programme.desc: A jaded computer programmer goes to bizarre lengths to get fired from his dull job - but his new laid-back attitude leads to unexpected promotions as his arrogance is taken for supreme self-confidence by unwitting bosses. Satirical comedy, starring Ron Livingston, Jennifer Aniston, Ajay Naidu and Gary Cole.(n)

programme.title: The Big Green
programme.desc: An English teacher provides her American pupils with an introduction to the joys of soccer, giving them the pride and ability to take on the best at the state championships, and winning the heart of the local sheriff along the way. Sporting comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Olivia d'Abo and Jay O Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Love Bug
programme.desc: Herbie, an irrepressible Beetle car with a mind of its own, takes a shine to a struggling racing driver and leads him to victory on the track. However, his success attracts the attention of an unscrupulous rival competitor, who will go to any lengths to win the most important race of all. Disney comedy, starring Dean Jones, Michele Lee, Buddy Hackett and David Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur: Sky Movies Special
programme.desc: Sky Movies takes a special look at Pixar's animated prehistoric adventure.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Dumbo
programme.desc: Disney animated adventure following the fortunes of a plucky young elephant with oversized ears. Mocked by his fellow circus performers, Dumbo finally finds a friend in an enterprising mouse, who helps the poor animal overcome his inhibitions and find fame and fortune as the world's only flying elephant. With the voices of Sterling Holloway and Edward Brophy, and an Oscar-winning score by Frank Churchill and Oliver Wallace.(n)

programme.title: The Fox and the Hound
programme.desc: An orphaned fox cub is taken in by a kindly widow, and becomes firm friends with a puppy belonging to a hunter. However, as they grow to adulthood, the dog is trained to prey on foxes, and the two animals realise their friendship may not survive as they are expected to be natural enemies. Animated adventure, with the voices of Mickey Rooney and Kurt Russell.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungle, leading a carefree life with his friends, a laidback bear and a wise panther. The return of a ferocious tiger who hates humans places the youngster's life in danger, and his friends must persuade him to return to the safety of his own people. Disney animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, with the voices of Phil Harris and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungle, leading a carefree life with his friends, a laidback bear and a wise panther. The return of a ferocious tiger who hates humans places the youngster's life in danger, and his friends must persuade him to return to the safety of his own people. Disney animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, with the voices of Phil Harris and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: McFarland, USA
programme.desc: A former American football coach takes a job at an underprivileged school with a mostly Hispanic student body, and finds he has a lot to learn about their lives. When he discovers many of his pupils have a talent for running, he forms an athletics team and leads them to glory. Fact-based drama, starring Kevin Costner and Ramiro Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke.(n)

programme.title: Deja Vu
programme.desc: A federal agent investigating the bombing of a ferryboat in New Orleans is given access by the government to a top-secret device that allows him to see into the past. He focuses on one victim in particular, a woman whom he believes holds the key to the crime, and becomes convinced that he can prevent the explosion ever happening. Sci-fi thriller, with Denzel Washington, Paula Patton, Val Kilmer and Jim Caviezel.(n)

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: A thief attempting to go straight is recruited by a scientist, who provides him with a suit that gives him the power to shrink. He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out Of The Shadows
programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes battle more bad guys when Shredder breaks out of custody and teams up with the villainous Krang. Action comedy sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Laura Linney.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
programme.desc: Frodo and Sam continue their quest to destroy the all-powerful ring, bringing them face to face with the magical artefact's twisted former owner Gollum. Meanwhile, their allies prepare to make a desperate last stand against the vast armies of the corrupted wizard Saruman, who has declared war on a neighbouring kingdom. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Sean Astin, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen, Billy Boyd, Dominic Monaghan, Andy Serkis and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Ant-Man
programme.desc: A thief attempting to go straight is recruited by a scientist, who provides him with a suit that gives him the power to shrink. He must use his new skills to carry out a special mission - helping the inventor to steal back his miniaturisation technology from a ruthless businessman who intends to turn it into a deadly weapon. Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out Of The Shadows
programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes battle more bad guys when Shredder breaks out of custody and teams up with the villainous Krang. Action comedy sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Laura Linney.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
programme.desc: Frodo and Sam continue their quest to destroy the all-powerful ring, bringing them face to face with the magical artefact's twisted former owner Gollum. Meanwhile, their allies prepare to make a desperate last stand against the vast armies of the corrupted wizard Saruman, who has declared war on a neighbouring kingdom. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Sean Astin, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen, Billy Boyd, Dominic Monaghan, Andy Serkis and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despot's reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan.(n)

programme.title: Mean Machine
programme.desc: A disgraced soccer star jailed for assaulting two policemen is persuaded by the prison authorities to form a football team of inmates to take on the guards. Unfortunately, whipping his fellow prisoners into shape proves a tricky proposition. Comedy drama, starring Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham, David Hemmings and Jason Flemyng.(n)

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: The bungling Inspector Clouseau is sent to investigate a high-profile murder case. All the clues point to a maid being the guilty party, but the accident-prone detective is instantly smitten with her, and devotes his efforts to proving her innocence - despite all evidence to the contrary. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders and Herbert Lom.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: The dying wife of a retired assassin leaves him a puppy, in the hope that having something to love will stop him returning to a life of violence when she is gone. When the son of a Russian gangster steals his car and kills the dog, the hitman is provoked into a murderous rage and slaughters his way through the underworld in search of revenge. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: As hobbits Frodo and Sam near the end of their journey into the dark lands of Mordor to destroy the One Ring, the evil Sauron unleashes the full might of his armies on Middle-earth. Meanwhile, Aragorn must fulfil his destiny of becoming king by leading his people into a climactic battle with the forces of darkness. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: The dying wife of a retired assassin leaves him a puppy, in the hope that having something to love will stop him returning to a life of violence when she is gone. When the son of a Russian gangster steals his car and kills the dog, the hitman is provoked into a murderous rage and slaughters his way through the underworld in search of revenge. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: As hobbits Frodo and Sam near the end of their journey into the dark lands of Mordor to destroy the One Ring, the evil Sauron unleashes the full might of his armies on Middle-earth. Meanwhile, Aragorn must fulfil his destiny of becoming king by leading his people into a climactic battle with the forces of darkness. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: McCanick
programme.desc: A narcotics cop learns a small-time crook has been released from prison and goes behind the chief of police's back to organise a disproportionate manhunt for him. As his methods grow increasingly brutal, he comes closer to learning a secret from his own past. Detective drama, starring David Morse and Cory Monteith, in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A quadriplegic ex-cop is saved from the brink of suicide by a rookie female officer needing his expertise to form a psychological profile of a serial killer. The murderer is posing as a cab driver and terrorising Manhattan, and has a gruesome habit of taking trophies from his victims' bodies. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Angelina Jolie, Michael Rooker, Mike McGlone, Luis Guzman and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Four Brothers
programme.desc: When their adoptive mother is killed in a robbery, her four sons reunite and swear vengeance on the murderers. But the background to her apparently random death turns out to be more complex than it first appeared, as the trail leads to corrupt cops and a notorious local gang boss. Thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Tyrese Gibson, Andre Benjamin, Garrett Hedlund, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Terrence Howard.(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds 3: Lockdown
programme.desc: A cop returns to duty after being injured in an incident that led to the death of his partner. On his first day back, he discovers evidence of corruption among his colleagues. He soon finds himself trapped inside his own precinct and fighting for survival against crooked cops determined to keep their misdeeds a secret. Action thriller sequel, starring Jonathan Good and Roger R Cross.(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Fast 8: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at Fast and the Furious 8 as Vin Diesel and company line up on the starting grid for another high-octane adventure.(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: A former gangster is released from jail and vows to go straight, hoping to earn enough money to escape his New York roots - but his misguided loyalty to a crooked lawyer threatens to drag him back into a life of crime. Brian De Palma's thriller, starring Al Pacino, Sean Penn, Penelope Ann Miller, John Leguizamo and Viggo Mortensen.(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Terrorists armed with the world's most lethal nerve gas take over an airliner and demand a massive ransom - and only a crack team of intelligence experts can stop them before they carry out their threat to destroy Washington, DC. Action thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Steven Seagal, Halle Berry, Oliver Platt, David Suchet and John Leguizamo.(n)

programme.title: Zulu
programme.desc: Two South African police officers, one black and one white, investigate the murder of a teenage girl. The case brings to light the lingering consequences of apartheid, and forces both men to face up to their own roles in their country's brutal history. Crime drama based on Caryl Ferey's novel, with Forest Whitaker and Orlando Bloom.(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall.(n)

programme.title: The Maid's Room
programme.desc: A Colombian immigrant hired as a live-in maid at a luxurious summer house in Long Island witnesses something she shouldn't. Thriller, starring Paula Garces, Annabella Sciorra and Bill Camp.(n)

programme.title: Freezer
programme.desc: Wisecracking ex-con Robert is kidnapped and held hostage in a walk-in freezer by Russian thugs, who are convinced he has $8million from them. As he struggles to fight back against the cold, he soon discovers he is not alone. Thriller, starring Dylan McDermott.(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.(n)

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: A detective is determined to bring his dead partner's killers to justice, despite warnings from both his superior officers and the murdered man's wife to forget about it. As he delves deeper, he uncovers dangerous secrets and evidence of political corruption, with a devoutly religious woman seemingly the key to the mystery. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Ana de Armas and Mira Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: An unstable Vietnam veteran cop teams up with a by-the-book Los Angeles police detective to investigate the apparent suicide of the daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading them to a violent and bloody confrontation with a ruthless drug cartel under the control of a retired US general. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan and Tom Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Headstrong cop Martin Riggs and his cautious partner Roger Murtaugh stumble across a plot by a South African diplomat to launder drugs money by shipping gold coins into the US via his embassy. Protected by diplomatic immunity, the crook looks certain to evade the law - while his chief henchman has a connection to Riggs' traumatic past. Action thriller sequel, with Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Joss Ackland, Derrick O'Connor and Patsy Kensit.(n)

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Trainee FBI agent Clarice Starling is sent to interview an imprisoned psychopath with a taste for eating his victims. The inmate offers to help catch a serial killer who is holding a politician's daughter hostage - but to learn what he knows, Clarice has to engage in his dangerous mind games. Jonathan Demme's Oscar-winning thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel, starring Jodie Foster, Anthony Hopkins, Scott Glenn and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective `Dirty' Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Although his own tactics barely stay within the confines of the law, he is determined the killer will face his particular brand of justice, regardless of his superiors' disapproval. Don Siegel's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Paint Your Wagon
programme.desc: A gold prospector buys a wife from a Mormon and agrees to share her with his mining partner when she insists they all live together. Mindful that her presence in an all-male town might give rise to jealousy, he hijacks a stagecoach carrying six working girls and opens a brothel in town. Oscar-nominated musical Western, starring Lee Marvin, Clint Eastwood, with Jean Seberg and Harve Presnell.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2 Special
programme.desc: Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks discuss reprising their roles for the comedy sequel.(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A New York advertising executive on the eve of his divorce tells his daughter about his love life before he was married, including how he met her mother. However, he changes the names of his former lovers, leaving the girl - and viewers - to guess which one of three women he ended up marrying. Romantic comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Abigail Breslin, Elizabeth Banks, Rachel Weisz and Isla Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A political advisor's career ends in disaster when she ends up at the centre of a major scandal. She is lured out of retirement to help the embattled president of Bolivia to get re-elected, but finds the opposition is being assisted by an old rival, who uses every dirty trick in the book to wreck her campaign. Comedy drama, starring Sandra Bullock, Billy Bob Thornton and Anthony Mackie.(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: A French acrobat hatches an audacious scheme to carry out his most spectacular performance in 1974. With the aid of his circus mentor and an international team of helpers, he plans to tightrope walk between the towers of the World Trade Centre. Fact-based drama, starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: A tone deaf socialite has dreams of becoming a singer, but problems arise when she decides to perform at Carnegie Hall. Fact-based comedy, starring Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Sabrina
programme.desc: A chauffeur's daughter falls for the womanising son of her father's employer, but he ignores her. However, after a long sojourn in Paris, she returns, having matured into a beautiful and poised young woman. The handsome playboy is totally smitten - even though he is on the verge of getting married. So to save the wedding, his older brother tries to romance her himself. Remake of Billy Wilder's romantic comedy, with Harrison Ford, Julia Ormond and Greg Kinnear.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: A tone deaf socialite has dreams of becoming a singer, but problems arise when she decides to perform at Carnegie Hall. Fact-based comedy, starring Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A political advisor's career ends in disaster when she ends up at the centre of a major scandal. She is lured out of retirement to help the embattled president of Bolivia to get re-elected, but finds the opposition is being assisted by an old rival, who uses every dirty trick in the book to wreck her campaign. Comedy drama, starring Sandra Bullock, Billy Bob Thornton and Anthony Mackie.(n)

programme.title: Tristan and Isolde
programme.desc: The love affair that develops between an English warrior and an Irish princess, while their two countries are at war, ends when the knight has to return to England in the service of his lord. The princess's cruel father then decides to auction her off for marriage to an English nobleman, forcing the former lovers to keep their relationship a secret. Romantic adventure set in the Dark Ages, with James Franco, Sophia Myles and Rufus Sewell.(n)

programme.title: White Bird in a Blizzard
programme.desc: A teenager relishes her newfound freedom when her mother goes missing, seizing the opportunity to flirt with the boy next door and a cop on the case. Over time, she begins to realise what she has lost and finds the unexplained details of the disappearance haunting her. Mystery based on Laura Kasischke's novel, starring Shailene Woodley and Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: John Huston's epic re-telling of the Book of Genesis, chronicling the stories of Adam and Eve, Noah and the flood and Abraham and Isaac. Starring Richard Harris, Peter O'Toole, Michael Parks, Ava Gardner, George C Scott and Huston himself as the voice of God.(n)

programme.title: Some Like It Hot
programme.desc: After witnessing a mob hit in Chicago, two male jazz musicians don drag and hide out with an all-girl band to evade the gangsters pursuing them. However, the pair struggle to disguise their attraction for the beautiful lead singer - while one of them catches the eye of a smitten millionaire. Billy Wilder's classic romantic comedy, starring Jack Lemmon, Tony Curtis and Marilyn Monroe.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: The Object of My Affection
programme.desc: Pregnant singleton Jennifer Aniston asks her homosexual friend to act as the baby's father, believing that between the two of them they will do an excellent job of raising the child. Nicholas Hytner's romantic comedy, co-starring Paul Rudd, Kali Rocha and Nigel Hawthorne.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2 Special
programme.desc: Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks discuss reprising their roles for the comedy sequel.(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widowed mother moves from New York City to Los Angeles to be with her daughter, but her well-meaning, meddlesome ways drive her offspring up the wall. Comedy-drama, starring Susan Sarandon, Rose Byrne and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: The Dressmaker
programme.desc: An Australian fashion designer returns to her remote home town in the 1950s after forging a successful career in Paris. She reconciles with her mother, falls in love and transforms the lives of the local women - getting even with her enemies in the process. Drama based on the novel by Rosalie Ham, starring Kate Winslet, Judy Davis, Hugo Weaving and Liam Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widowed mother moves from New York City to Los Angeles to be with her daughter, but her well-meaning, meddlesome ways drive her offspring up the wall. Comedy-drama, starring Susan Sarandon, Rose Byrne and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Proof of Life
programme.desc: A woman seeks the help of a professional negotiator after her husband is kidnapped in the jungles of South America, but events are complicated when the pair find that working together under such stressful circumstances has unforeseen consequences. Action drama, starring Russell Crowe, Meg Ryan, David Morse and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: Dumbo
programme.desc: Disney animated adventure following the fortunes of a plucky young elephant with oversized ears. Mocked by his fellow circus performers, Dumbo finally finds a friend in an enterprising mouse, who helps the poor animal overcome his inhibitions and find fame and fortune as the world's only flying elephant. With the voices of Sterling Holloway and Edward Brophy, and an Oscar-winning score by Frank Churchill and Oliver Wallace.(n)

programme.title: Treasure Buddies
programme.desc: Five golden retriever puppies embark on a danger-filled quest halfway across the world as they search for the greatest treasure known to animalkind. Arriving in Egypt, the canine explorers make some new exotic friends and search through ancient ruins as they try to stop devious sphynx cat Ubasti from claiming their prize. Family adventure sequel, with the voices of Skyler Gisondo and Elaine Hendrix.(n)

programme.title: Maya the Bee Movie
programme.desc: A curious young bee befriends a number of other insects, despite her hive's strict rules on not associating with outsiders. When some of the Queen bee's royal jelly is stolen, she is accused of the crime and needs the help of her friends to track down the real culprits. Animated adventure based on Waldemar Bonsels' children's book, with the voices of Coco Jack Gillies and Kodi Smit-McPhee.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Angry Birds Movie
programme.desc: Outsider Red does not fit in among his island community, but he is the only one to smell a rat when a fleet of green pigs pitch up. Animation, with the voice of Jason Sudeikis.(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo
programme.desc: The hapless hound and his chums reunite after a bitter break-up to solve a baffling mystery in the ghost-themed tourist resort of Spooky Island, whose owner is convinced he has a genuine haunting on his hands. Live-action comedy adventure based on the cartoon series, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Linda Cardellini and Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Aquamarine
programme.desc: A mermaid fleeing an arranged marriage becomes stranded at a beach resort. There she meets two local girls - lifelong friends about to be separated when one of them moves to Australia - and seeks their help in winning the heart of a lifeguard she has fallen for. In return, she promises to grant them their wish to stay together. Fantasy comedy, with Sara Paxton, Emma Roberts and Joanna Levesque.(n)

programme.title: Dennis
programme.desc: A well-meaning little boy with an inability to stay out of trouble is the bane of his curmudgeonly neighbour, Mr Wilson. But when a thief steals Wilson's coin collection, the tiny terror seizes the chance to make amends and come to the rescue. Slapstick comedy based on the comic strip, starring Walter Matthau, Mason Gamble, Joan Plowright, Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo
programme.desc: The hapless hound and his chums reunite after a bitter break-up to solve a baffling mystery in the ghost-themed tourist resort of Spooky Island, whose owner is convinced he has a genuine haunting on his hands. Live-action comedy adventure based on the cartoon series, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Linda Cardellini and Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the latest trip into JK Rowling's wizarding world, including interviews with stars Eddie Redmayne and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age
programme.desc: Three mismatched prehistoric animals join forces to return a human infant to its tribe - but as their journey unfolds, the creatures fail to anticipate the many perils and pitfalls that lay in store for them. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of John Leguizamo, Ray Romano, Denis Leary, Goran Visnjic and Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: The Meltdown
programme.desc: Sid the sloth, Manny the mammoth and Diego the sabre-toothed tiger grimly realise the good life is about to come to an abrupt end as flood waters threaten their homes. However, a vulture suggests they could turn an old giant tree into a boat and make their escape, so the three friends set off in search of it. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo and Denis Leary.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 3
programme.desc: The clumsy hero is reunited with his long-lost father, whose help he will need when a supernatural foe threatens all of China. Father and son travel to a secret village populated by other pandas, and must train them in martial arts so they can defend their home. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black, Bryan Cranston, Angelina Jolie and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: An intelligent parrot falls into late-night conversation with a janitor and ends up recounting the tale of his epic cross-country journey in search of a new life - a plan that went awry when an evil scientist managed to get his hands on the brilliant bird for his own nefarious ends. Family adventure, starring Gena Rowlands, Tony Shalhoub, Cheech Marin, Bruce Davison and the voice of Jay Mohr.(n)

programme.title: Don't Breathe
programme.desc: Premiere. A trio of thieves break into the house of a blind man who is not as helpless as he seems, and their hopes of walking away with a massive fortune do not go to plan. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette.(n)

programme.desc: A father consumed by grief must come to terms with an emotional breakdown in order to save his relationship with his two young sons. Drama, starring Tommy Flanagan, Edward Ashley and David Broughton-Davies.(n)

programme.title: Continuum
programme.desc: A physicist makes a discovery that throws fresh light on his father's unexplained disappearance. He seems to have been transported through time, and there is a chance to bring him back - but doing so has dangerous consequences, leaving the scientist and his mother with a terrible choice. Sci-fi drama, starring Gillian Anderson and Haley Joel Osment.(n)

programme.title: Bicentennial Man
programme.desc: A family purchases a robot servant to perform menial tasks but quickly realises this is no ordinary droid when he begins to develop human emotions and the capacity to think for himself, a quality encouraged by his owner's children. He asks for his freedom, and spends the next 200 years struggling to come to terms with its humanity. Chris Columbus's sci-fi drama inspired by the books of Isaac Asimov, starring Robin Williams, Sam Neill, Embeth Davidtz and Oliver Platt.(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A psychiatrist arrives on a space station to investigate the death of its commanding officer but subsequently starts to experience frightening visions of his late wife - which seem all too real and force him to question his sanity. Sci-fi drama, directed by Steven Soderbergh and based on Stanislaw Lem's novel, starring George Clooney, Natascha McElhone, Viola Davis, Jeremy Davies and Ulrich Tukur.(n)

programme.title: Anguish
programme.desc: A teenage girl has struggled with mental health issues all her life, experiencing anxiety attacks and hallucinations. She discovers that her condition may be the result of a spirit possessing her - a revelation that leaves her forced to choose whether to allow the entity to take her over utterly or to fight to keep it under control. Horror, starring Ryan Simpkins and Annika Marks.(n)

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell: Special
programme.desc: A look at the live-action remake of the iconic sci-fi animation, starring Scarlett Johansson, Takeshi Kitano and Michael Pitt.(n)

programme.title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
programme.desc: A stormtrooper fighting for an evil regime turns against his masters. He joins forces with a desert scavenger, and together they are drawn into the search for legendary war hero Luke Skywalker, who disappeared years previously. Meanwhile, a terrible weapon is about to be unleashed, that will allow the forces of evil to dominate the galaxy once again. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Harrison Ford and Adam Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Friend Request
programme.desc: A teenager meets a girl online, only to find she is a demonic entity intent on killing her real friends. Horror, starring Alycia Debnam-Carey and William Moseley.(n)

programme.title: Unfriended
programme.desc: A group of friends using an online chatroom find themselves being stalked by an account in the name of a friend, who died a year earlier. Thriller, starring Shelley Hennig and Heather Sossaman.(n)

programme.title: Hacked
programme.desc: A student watches a video of a murder on the internet, but the police refuse to believe the events in the film are real. She sets out to prove someone really has been killed, only to find herself trapped in a deadly game and in danger of becoming the murderer's next target. Thriller, starring Melanie Papalia and David Schlachtenhaufen.(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Cop John Anderton is forced to go on the run when a supposedly infallible trio of psychics foretell he is about to kill a man he has never heard of. Convinced their prediction is false, he kidnaps one of the so-called precogs to prove his innocence - and stumbles across a complex conspiracy. Steven Spielberg's futuristic thriller, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell: Special
programme.desc: A look at the live-action remake of the iconic sci-fi animation, starring Scarlett Johansson, Takeshi Kitano and Michael Pitt.(n)

programme.title: Titan AE
programme.desc: In the year 3038, an alien race has annihilated almost all of mankind and destroyed the Earth. A scientist escapes the planet on board a craft that is destined to be humanity's only chance of future survival - the spaceship Titan. Fourteen years later, his estranged son plucks up courage and sets out on a perilous journey to find the ship and reunite with his father. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Matt Damon, Bill Pullman and Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Body
programme.desc: Three students break into a house mistakenly thinking it belongs to their friend, and end up accidentally killing the groundskeeper who catches them trespassing. They try to come up with an elaborate lie to cover up their crime, but their consiences begin to trouble them, with deadly consequences. Thriller, starring Helen Rogers, Alexandra Turshen and Lauren Molina.(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy.(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: A dull American town in the middle of the desert is suddenly attacked by huge man-eating subterranean creatures. Luckily, two dimwitted but brave handymen step into the breach to lead a ragtag bunch of locals and a mismatched pair of survivalists in the battle against the gruesome worm-like monsters. Comedy horror, with Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross, Reba McEntire and Bobby Jacoby.(n)

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, another woman has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr.(n)

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: Greta (Lauren Cohan) takes a job as a nanny for a young boy in an English village. Upon her arrival, she discovers that the child is actually a life-size doll that the parents have been using as a coping mechanism since the death of their eight-year-old son two decades earlier. After the initial shock wears off, Greta decides to stay and work for the couple, but when she breaks a few strictly enforced rules of their "son's" care, she begins to suspect the toy may not be a doll at all. Directed by William Brent Bell. Rupert Evans, Jim Norton, Diana Hardcastle, Ben Robson, and James Russell co-star(n)

programme.title: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
programme.desc: 'Twin Peaks' fans will be happy to see a chronicle of Laura Palmer's last seven days alive. During the day she is a diligent and cheerful student, by night she is a promiscuous drug abuser working in a seedy sex club. The FBI are already investigating the murder of another teenager, but when Laura is also killed, they suspect deeper, sinister motives and Special Agent Dale Cooper is called onto the case(n)

programme.desc: Scientists perform paranormal experiments on a woman, and strive to weaponise the evil within her. But the otherworldly power proves stronger than anyone anticipated, prompting a shocking series of events that the government tries to cover up(n)

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Terrifying shocker about a foul-smelling creature that raises a horrific stink in an abandoned desert town. The monster targets a quintet of young travelers who get lost. Devon Gummersall stars as the brilliant but blind leader of the pack. Written and directed by Dave Payne(n)

programme.title: The Spirit
programme.desc: A murdered cop returns from the dead as The Spirit, his mission to clean up the crime-ravaged streets of Central City. He sets out to conquer his nemesis The Octopus, a villain who kills anyone unfortunate enough to see his face. Although he is physically indestructible, our hero is distracted by a seemingly endless bevy of beautiful yet dangerous femme fatales determined either to seduce him or kill him(n)

programme.title: Capsule
programme.desc: A British fighter pilot trains to be an astronaut during the Cold War, but his space vessel malfunctions and he fights hypoxia as he gets mixed signals from the UK, the U.S. and Soviet Russia on the ground(n)

programme.title: Whiskers
programme.desc: Lonely for a friend of his own, an 11-year-old boy invokes special plea to an ancient Egyptian goddess and has her turn his pet cat into a friend. Unfortunately, something goes a little haywire, for the boy's new pal acts like a 30-year-old man(n)

programme.title: The Culling
programme.desc: The plans of five college friends headed for a fun-filled weekend get abruptly changed when they find a 7-year-old girl alone at an empty café and have no choice but to drive her home. Once there, the group's worst nightmares are realized(n)

programme.title: The Final Cut
programme.desc: First-time filmmaker Omar Naim wrote and directed the sci-fi drama The Final Cut. Set in the near future, the story concerns a device implanted in the body that is capable of recording a person's entire life. Once it is extracted from the body after death, the footage can be played back on a screen in the form of "rememories." Robin Williams plays Alan Hakman, an editor who cuts together the footage to make pleasant movies for funerals. Tormented by his job and his own memories, Alan also has a troubled romantic relationship with bookseller Delila (Mira Sorvino). While looking through footage for his next project, Alan discovers a man whom he believes is from his own past. Meanwhile, former editor Fletcher (James Caviezel) wants the footage for his own purposes. The Final Cut was shown at the Berlin Film Festival in 2004(n)

programme.title: Unnatural
programme.desc: Genetically created polar bears run amok and terrorize everyone in sight after they are created by a company seeking to take advantage of global warming(n)

programme.desc: In this spoof of horror flicks, a reporter investigates a string of murders at a high school. Meanwhile, the school's principal tries to protect his students by hiring a mall rent-a-cop to act as a security guard(n)

programme.desc: A horror-movie fan interviews lovers of the genre to understand why people like to be scared(n)

programme.desc: Three hi-tech tribes engage in a deadly war for supremacy and survival on a distant planet in this live-action/animated sci-fi thriller from genre luminary Oshii Mamoru(n)

programme.title: The Last Keepers
programme.desc: A teenager learns that she descends from a long line of powerful witches, and strives to embrace her true destiny(n)

programme.title: Walter
programme.desc: A movie-theater cashier believes he's the son of God, and is accosted by a ghost who claims to dwell in limbo. This forces him to rethink his place in the universe, and soon he believes the ghost can help him understand his fate(n)

programme.title: Bang Bang Baby
programme.desc: Sci-fi musical set in the 1960s centers on teen who believes her hopes of becoming a famous singer will come true when her rock star idol gets stranded in town and romance blooms between them. But a leak at a nearby chemical plant threatens to turn her dream into a nightmare(n)

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: A high schooler discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman(n)

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story
programme.desc: Relegated to a forlorn afterlife of unsmiling lost souls and melancholy drifters as a result of committing suicide in the mortal realm, a heartbroken young man sets out to find the girl who inspired his final act of self-destruction after learning that she too has taken her own life in director Goran Dukic's adaptation of Etgar Keret's darkly comic novella Kneller's Happy Campers. A likeable young man despite his depressive disposition, Zia (Patrick Fugit) puts blade to wrist only to find that the pain of life doesn't end with the coming of death. Now trapped in a bleak metaphysical landscape populated entirely by suicide victims blearily searching for the joys that eluded them in the physical realm, Zia soon learns that the love is one of the latest arrivals in the dreary land of the dead. As Zia sets out to locate his ill-fated former companion and experience the joys that eluded the couple in life, he is joined in his quest by a lovelorn Russian rocker named Eugene (Shea Wigham) and an accidental tourist named Mikal (Shannyn Sossamon), who's looking for a way out of the sorrowful stir(n)

programme.title: The Hills Have Eyes
programme.desc: A family must face-off against a band of bloodthirsty, hill-dwelling cannibals after their trailer breaks down, stranding them in the desert(n)

programme.title: Bloodsucking Bastards
programme.desc: In this gory workplace comedy, a hapless cubicle drone must defend himself against a new boss who's really a malevolent vampire, intent on populating the office with more of his kind(n)

programme.title: Hit Me
programme.desc: A suicidal man (Christian Svensson) whose wife left him and took their child wants to cancel the hit he purchased on himself. Morocco Omari. Directed by Steven Minor(n)

programme.title: Paranoia
programme.desc: Director Robert Luketic and screenwriters Jason Dean Hall and Barry Levy team up to adapt author Joseph Finder's novel centering on a tech-savvy twentysomething who becomes a corporate spy for a scheming businessman. Determined to make the most of his new job at Wyatt Telecom, Adam Cassidy (Liam Hemsworth) is horrified when a felonious mistake earns him the wrath of unforgiving CEO Nicholas Wyatt (Gary Oldman). Typically, Wyatt's first response would be to throw a lawbreaking employee under the bus. But this time he's willing to cut a deal: Should Adam agree to infiltrate Wyatt Telecom's chief rival, the CEO will turn a blind eye to his employee's error. In no time Adam is climbing the corporate ladder straight to the top. No one suspects a thing, and Wyatt is gaining a distinct advantage over the competition. Later, upon realizing that his success is a mere illusion and he's become a simple pawn in a much bigger game, Adam hatches an ingenious plan to get out of his situation before it's too late(n)

programme.title: The Howling Reborn
programme.desc: A high school senior learns he descends from a long line of werewolves, and attempts to choose between embracing his inner-beast and holding on to his humanity as the long-running horror franchise returns. Will Kidman (Landon Liboiron) is your typical teenager; he's got an eye for girls, and lately his gaze has been lingering on a gorgeous classmate (Lindsey Shaw). Meanwhile, an enigmatic woman (Ivana Milicevic) from Will's distant past resurfaces with a shocking revelation: Will's ancestors were lycanthropes, and now he will inherit the secrets of their incredible power. But when Will realizes that embracing his destiny will spell certain death for the girl he loves, he prepares to make a choice that could spell the end of his monstrous bloodline, and incur the wrath of the very creatures that have claimed him as one of their own(n)

programme.title: Meet the Hitlers
programme.desc: The lives of people linked by the name Hitler are examined. Their reactions span the spectrum of human experience, from tragedy to comedy, and heartbreak to hope(n)

programme.title: Burning Bodhi
programme.desc: A circle of high-school friends reunite a few years after graduation for the funeral of Bodhi, the most-popular member of their group. However, Dylan is reluctant to attend because it will mean seeing Katy, an ex who once cheated on him with Bodhi and who is now a drug addict(n)

programme.title: Paranoia
programme.desc: Director Robert Luketic and screenwriters Jason Dean Hall and Barry Levy team up to adapt author Joseph Finder's novel centering on a tech-savvy twentysomething who becomes a corporate spy for a scheming businessman. Determined to make the most of his new job at Wyatt Telecom, Adam Cassidy (Liam Hemsworth) is horrified when a felonious mistake earns him the wrath of unforgiving CEO Nicholas Wyatt (Gary Oldman). Typically, Wyatt's first response would be to throw a lawbreaking employee under the bus. But this time he's willing to cut a deal: Should Adam agree to infiltrate Wyatt Telecom's chief rival, the CEO will turn a blind eye to his employee's error. In no time Adam is climbing the corporate ladder straight to the top. No one suspects a thing, and Wyatt is gaining a distinct advantage over the competition. programme.title: Meskada
programme.desc: Class and economics muddy the investigation of a homicide in this thriller from director Josh Sternfeld. When a child is found murdered in the small town of Hilliard, police detective Noah Cordin (Nick Stahl) is assigned to investigate the case. The victim's mother, Allison Connor (Laura Benanti), is a wealthy and well-connected member of the County Board of Commissioners, so Cordin is under pressure to find the killer as soon as possible, but working with rookie officer Leslie Spencer (Rachel Nichols), he isn't finding many substantial clues. One of the few pieces of evidence suggests the culprit may have been from the nearby town of Caswell. Cordin was born and raised in Caswell and knows its history well -- while Hilliard is a prosperous suburban community, Caswell is a working-class town fallen on hard times, and its survival is dependent on a proposed factory coming into town. As Cordin spends more and more time in Caswell, he becomes a target for the resentment the locals feel toward their wealthier neighbors, and a tense situation becomes potentially explosive when word begins to circulate that Connor may use her influence to keep the new employer out of Caswell unless someone comes forward to identity who killed her son. Meskada (named for the county that contains both Hilliard and Caswell) also stars Norman Reedus, Kellan Lutz, Jonathan Tucker, and Grace Gummer(n)

programme.desc: Entropy Is Contagious. Marty and Jeannie pitch opposing strategies to a Seattle-based skincare company. Meanwhile, Doug gets fed up with Sarah's antics and puts his foot down; and Clyde discusses a business idea with an unlikely partner(n)

programme.sub-title: We Can Always Just Overwhelm the Vagus Nerve With Another Sensation

programme.title: House of Lies
programme.sub-title: The Next Olive Branch Goes Straight Up Your Ass
programme.desc: The Next Olive Branch Goes Straight Up Your Ass. Trouble arises at Kaan and Associates when payment is not received from a consult. Meanwhile, Clyde gets a visit from his estranged father; Marty learns of Roscoe's entrepreneurial endeavors; and Jeannie pushes back to stay(n)

programme.sub-title: He Didn't Mean That, Natalie Portman

programme.sub-title: Everything's So F**king Obvious, I'm Starting to Wonder Why We're Even Having This Co
programme.desc: Everything's So F**king Obvious, I'm Starting to Wonder Why We're Even Having This Co. Meanwhile, Jeannie gives birth; Clyde, Doug and Kelsey await an offer; and Roscoe faces the consequences(n)

programme.desc: Class and economics muddy the investigation of a homicide in this thriller from director Josh Sternfeld. programme.title: HIGH School
programme.desc: A straight-laced high-school valedictorian schemes to get the entire senior class stoned in order to circumvent his principal's mandatory drug-testing policy. Henry Burke (Matt Bush) is the kind of teenager every parent dreams about having; he never ditches school, gets straight A's, and he's secured a college scholarship to pay for his higher education. Unfortunately there's just one thing standing in between Henry and his bright future -- his high-school principal. An uptight authoritarian with a hard-line anti-marijuana stance, Principal Gordon (Michael Chiklis) announces that the entire senior class will undergo mandatory drug testing, and anyone who refuses will be immediately expelled. Henry has just danced with Mary Jane for the very first time, and now his entire future is on the line thanks to a few innocent tokes. But Henry is a bright kid, and when he and local pothead Travix Breaux (Sean Marquette) put their heads together, they come up with a brilliant plan to subvert the testing policy: if they can just get every student in school stoned, Principal Gordon's plan to crucify his pot-loving charges will go completely up in smoke(n)

programme.title: Anarchy Parlor
programme.desc: Six youths vacationing in Eastern Europe run afoul of a deranged local with an unusual business(n)

programme.title: House of Lies
